original: phyi ma'i tshe la zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pha rol du'o //
analyzed: phyi ma'i tshe la zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pha rol du'o //

analyzed: yang sa bon gyi zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni 'di ltar dge slong dag sa bon gyi rnam pa lnga ma grugs ma smas ma rul la /

original: rlung dang nyi mas ma nyams shing drung po legs par gnas la /
analyzed: rlung dang nyi mas ma nyams shing drung po legs par gnas la /

original: sa'i khams dang chu'i khams kyang yod @154a * //
analyzed: sa'i khams dang chu'i khams kyang yod @154a * //

analyzed: na ; de lta na sa bon de dag 'phel zhing rgyas pa dang mched par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: dge slong dag de ltar na don 'di khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir dpe 'di bstan pa yin te /

original: 'dir don ni 'di yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir don ni 'di yin par blta bar bya'o //

original: dge slong dag sa bon gyi rim pa lnga zhes bya ba 'di ni nye bar len pa dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa'i tshig bla dags yin no //
analyzed: dge slong dag sa bon gyi rim pa lnga zhes bya ba 'di ni nye bar len pa dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa'i tshig bla dags yin no //
translated: Monks, ‚Äòthe five aspects of the seed‚Äô is a synonym for consciousness with appropriating.

original: sa'i khams zhes bya ba 'di ni rnam par shes pa gnas pa bzhi'i tshig bla dgas yin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: sa'i khams zhes bya ba 'di ni rnam par shes pa gnas pa bzhi'i tshig bla dgas yin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The expression ‚Äúthe earth element‚Äù is a designation for the four stations of consciousness.

original: sa bon ni rgyu yin no //
analyzed: sa bon ni rgyu yin no //
translated: The seed is the cause.

original: rgyu gang yin pa de kun 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: rgyu gang yin pa de kun 'byung ba yin no //

original: de ltar na de'i tshe rnam par shes pa kun 'byung ba nyid du bstan la /
analyzed: de ltar na de'i tshe rnam par shes pa kun 'byung ba nyid du bstan la /
translated: Thus, at that time, consciousness is taught to be the origination.

original: rnam par shes pa gnas pa dag kyang rten gyi rgyur bstan pas gzugs dang tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed dag kyang kun 'byung ba nyid du gsungs so //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gnas pa dag kyang rten gyi rgyur bstan pas gzugs dang tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed dag kyang kun 'byung ba nyid du gsungs so //

original: tshigs su bcad pa las /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa las /
translated: In the verse,

analyzed: las la sogs pa rnams kyang rgyur gsungs pas kun 'byung ba nyid du grub bo //
translated: action, etc., are also taught to be the cause. Therefore, they are established as the origination.

original: de'i phyir mdo las bstan pa ni dgongs pa can yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir mdo las bstan pa ni dgongs pa can yin te /
translated: Therefore, the teaching in the sutra is interpretable in meaning.

original: sred pa kun 'byung ba yin no zhes bya ba ni gdul ba'i khyad par la ltos pa'i phyir sred pa lhag pa'i gang zag gi dbang du mdzad na bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: sred pa kun 'byung ba yin no zhes bya ba ni gdul ba'i khyad par la ltos pa'i phyir sred pa lhag pa'i gang zag gi dbang du mdzad na bstan pa yin no //

original: chos mngon pa las zag pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po thams cad kun 'byung ba yin no zhes bstan pa ni mtshan nyid pa yin no //
analyzed: chos mngon pa las zag pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po thams cad kun 'byung ba yin no zhes bstan pa ni mtshan nyid pa yin no //

original: da ni bye brag tu smra ba'i mdo las bstan pa dgongs pa can nyid yin par bstan pa'i phyir gzhan yang mngon par grub pa'i rgyu zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //

original: mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu ni bdag nyid rnyed pa tsam gyi rgyu ste /
analyzed: mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu ni bdag nyid rnyed pa tsam gyi rgyu ste /

original: der skye ba'i rgyu ni las yin no //
analyzed: der skye ba'i rgyu ni las yin no //

original: mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu ni sred pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu ni sred pa'o //

original: yang tshigs su bcad pa las skye ba'i rgyu las yin pa dang / mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu sred pa yin par bshad do zhes bya ba 'di ji ltar shes she na /

original: de'i phyir mdo las las ni skye ba'i rgyu yin la sred pa mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yin no zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //

original: yang na mdo las rgyu dang bcas rkyen dang bcas /
analyzed: yang na mdo las rgyu dang bcas rkyen dang bcas /

original: de las rim pa ji ltar 'byung zhe na /

original: skye gnas la sogs pa'i rnam pa'i bye brag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni rigs pa dang / skyes pa dang bud med la sogs pa'i rnam par bsdu ste /

translated: The phrase ‚Äúdue to the specific features of the birth process, etc.‚Äù includes the specific features of the species, male and female, etc.

original: 'dir ni las kyang sred pa srid par nying mtshams sbyor ba la bye brag dang thun mong gi rkyen nyid yin par bstan to //üîΩdper na sa bon ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /

translated: Here, karma is taught to be the specific and common condition for craving that links one to existence.

original: s'a lu'i sa bon ni s'a lu'i myu gu skye ba'i rgyu yin la /
analyzed: s'a lu'i sa bon ni s'a lu'i myu gu skye ba'i rgyu yin la /

original: nas kyi sa bon ni nas kyi myu gu skye ba'i rgyu yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: nas kyi sa bon ni nas kyi myu gu skye ba'i rgyu yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //

original: chu ni bye brag med par s'a lu'i myu gu skye ba'i rgyu yin pa ji lta ba de bzhin du nas kyi myu gu la sogs pa'i yang yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //

translated: Water is the cause of the arising of a rice sprout without distinction, and it is also the cause of the arising of a barley sprout, and so on.

original: de'i phyir de dag ni myu gu thams cad skye ba tsam gyi rgyu yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag ni myu gu thams cad skye ba tsam gyi rgyu yin no //
translated: Therefore, they are the cause of the mere arising of all sprouts.

original: sred pa dang bral ba skye ba med pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba ni sred pa dang bral ba skye ba med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: sred pa dang bral ba skye ba med pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba ni sred pa dang bral ba skye ba med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the one free from craving is unborn.

original: de yod na yod la /
analyzed: de yod na yod la /
translated: Because it exists when craving exists and

original: med na med pas sred pa skye ba mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yin no zhes bya bar rtogs so //
analyzed: med na med pas sred pa skye ba mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yin no zhes bya bar rtogs so //
translated: does not exist when craving does not exist, craving is the cause for the actualization of birth.

original: de nyid rab tu dbye bar bya ba'i phyir gnyi ga 'chi ba las zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de nyid rab tu dbye bar bya ba'i phyir gnyi ga 'chi ba las zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: In order to analyze that very craving, he says, ‚ÄúBoth die from both.‚Äù

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i yul gang la sred pa dang lhan cig yin pas sred pa dang bcas pa der sems kyi rgyun yang dang yang du gzhol zhing 'jug par mthong ngo //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i yul gang la sred pa dang lhan cig yin pas sred pa dang bcas pa der sems kyi rgyun yang dang yang du gzhol zhing 'jug par mthong ngo //
translated: It is seen that the continuum of mind repeatedly inclines toward and engages the object of craving, such as form, because it is associated with craving.

original: yang srid pa la @155a * //
analyzed: yang srid pa la @155a * //
translated: It is known that it is the same for rebirth.

original: yang de dang 'dra'o zhes bya bar shes so zhes bya ba ni 'chi ba na yang srid pa'i phung po dag la sred pa dang bcas pas sred pa'i stobs kyis yang srid par yang de'i sems kyi rgyud 'jug go zhes bya bar nges so //
analyzed: yang de dang 'dra'o zhes bya bar shes so zhes bya ba ni 'chi ba na yang srid pa'i phung po dag la sred pa dang bcas pas sred pa'i stobs kyis yang srid par yang de'i sems kyi rgyud 'jug go zhes bya bar nges so //
translated: It is ascertained that at death, the continuum of mind engages rebirth because it is associated with craving for the aggregates of rebirth and because of the power of craving.

original: de ltar ni gang gis kyang lus kun du ma bzung ste zhes bya ba 'dis ni lus sred pa'i dbang du gyur pa nyid du ston to //
analyzed: de ltar ni gang gis kyang lus kun du ma bzung ste zhes bya ba 'dis ni lus sred pa'i dbang du gyur pa nyid du ston to //
translated: Thus, not held together by anything at all shows that the body is under the power of craving.

original: rgyu gzhan ni zhes bya ba 'dis ni lus la sred pa rtag tu rjes su 'brel par ston pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu gzhan ni zhes bya ba 'dis ni lus la sred pa rtag tu rjes su 'brel par ston pa'o //
translated: The phrase another cause shows that craving for the body is always present.

original: 'dag pa'i chal sran chung gi phye ma'i 'dag gu bskams pas lus bzung ba bzhin zhes bya ba la sran chung gi phye ma las byas pa'i 'dag pa'i chal ni sran chung gi phyi ma'i 'dag gu'o //üîΩdes bskus pa ni 'dag pa'i chal sran chung gi phye ma'i 'dag gus bskus pa'o //
analyzed: 'dag pa'i chal sran chung gi phye ma'i 'dag gu bskams pas lus bzung ba bzhin zhes bya ba la sran chung gi phye ma las byas pa'i 'dag pa'i chal ni sran chung gi phyi ma'i 'dag gu'o // des bskus pa ni 'dag pa'i chal sran chung gi phye ma'i 'dag gus bskus pa'o //
translated: The phrase like a body anointed with a paste of yellow myrobalan powder means that the paste is made of yellow myrobalan powder.üîΩIt is anointed by it.

original: de lus gang du bskams pa ni 'dag pa'i chal sran chung gi phye ma'i 'dag gus bskus pa bskams pa'i lus so //
analyzed: de lus gang du bskams pa ni 'dag pa'i chal sran chung gi phye ma'i 'dag gus bskus pa bskams pa'i lus so //
translated: The body dried by that is the body dried by the paste of yellow myrobalan powder.

original: 'dag pa'i chal sran chung gi phye ma'i 'dag gus bskus pa bskams pa'i lus lta bu ni 'dag pa'i chal sran chung gi phye ma'i 'dag gus bskus pa bskams pa'i lus bzhin te /
analyzed: 'dag pa'i chal sran chung gi phye ma'i 'dag gus bskus pa bskams pa'i lus lta bu ni 'dag pa'i chal sran chung gi phye ma'i 'dag gus bskus pa bskams pa'i lus bzhin te /
translated: The body that is anointed with a paste of white mustard seed powder and then dried is like the body anointed with a paste of white mustard seed powder and then dried.

original: ji ltar 'dag pa'i chal sran chung gi phye ma'i 'dag gus bskus pa bskams pas lus bzung ba de bzhin du sred pas lus bzung ngo zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dag pa'i chal sran chung gi phye ma'i 'dag gus bskus pa bskams pas lus bzung ba de bzhin du sred pas lus bzung ngo zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as the body is anointed with a paste of white mustard seed powder and then dried, so the body is anointed with craving and then dried.

original: bden pa'i zhar la 'di brjod par bya'o ;
analyzed: bden pa'i zhar la 'di brjod par bya'o ;
translated: This should be stated as a truth.üîΩIn this regard, two examples are cited:

original: / gang la bcom dang zhes bya ba 'di la dpe gnyis nye bar bkod pa yin te /
analyzed: / gang la bcom dang zhes bya ba 'di la dpe gnyis nye bar bkod pa yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúThat which is destroyed‚Äù and ‚Äúthat which is broken.‚Äù

original: 'jig pa gnyis nye bar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig pa gnyis nye bar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because two kinds of destruction are taught.

original: 'joms pas 'jig pa ni bum pa la sogs pa dag go //
analyzed: 'joms pas 'jig pa ni bum pa la sogs pa dag go //
translated: Destruction by destruction refers to such things as pots.

original: blos 'jig pa ni chu la sogs pa dag ste /
analyzed: blos 'jig pa ni chu la sogs pa dag ste /
translated: Destruction by cognition refers to such things as water.

original: bcom pas ro la sogs pa bsal bar mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bcom pas ro la sogs pa bsal bar mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not tenable that the taste, etc., is removed by destruction.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na kun rdzob ni rnam pa gnyis te dbyibs kyi kun rdzob bum pa la sogs pa dang / tshogs pa'i kun rdzob chu la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na kun rdzob ni rnam pa gnyis te dbyibs kyi kun rdzob bum pa la sogs pa dang / tshogs pa'i kun rdzob chu la sogs pa ste /
translated: In one sense, the conventional is twofold: the conventional of shape, such as a pot, etc., and the conventional of an aggregation, such as water, etc.

original: de'i phyir gnyis smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir gnyis smos so //
translated: Therefore, two examples are mentioned.

original: yang na bum chu bzhin du kun rdzob tu //
analyzed: yang na bum chu bzhin du kun rdzob tu //
translated: Or, like a pot and water,

original: zhes dpe gnyis bkod pa ni kun rdzob gnyis bstan pa'i phyir te ;
analyzed: zhes dpe gnyis bkod pa ni kun rdzob gnyis bstan pa'i phyir te ;
translated: the two examples are set forth in order to demonstrate the two conventions.

original: bum pa la sogs pa yod pa rnams ni gyo mo la sogs pa dag la brten nas yod pas kun rdzob gzhan la brten pa'i kun rdzob yin la /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa yod pa rnams ni gyo mo la sogs pa dag la brten nas yod pas kun rdzob gzhan la brten pa'i kun rdzob yin la /
translated: Since those that exist, such as a pot, etc., exist in dependence on their parts, such as a base, etc., they are the conventional that is dependent on another conventional.

original: chu la sogs pa rnams ni gzugs la sogs pa la brten nas yod pas rdzas gzhan la brten pa'i kun rdzob yin no //
analyzed: chu la sogs pa rnams ni gzugs la sogs pa la brten nas yod pas rdzas gzhan la brten pa'i kun rdzob yin no //
translated: Since water, etc., exist in dependence on form, etc., they are the conventional that is dependent on another substance.üîΩOne should understand feeling, etc., in the same way.

original: tshor ba la sogs pa la yang de @155b bzhin du blta bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni tshor ba dang 'du shes dang sems pa la sogs pa dag kyang tshogs pa kun rdzob tu yod pa yin la /
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa la yang de @155b bzhin du blta bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni tshor ba dang 'du shes dang sems pa la sogs pa dag kyang tshogs pa kun rdzob tu yod pa yin la /
translated: Feeling, conceptualization, volition, etc., also exist as an aggregation conventionally.

original: tshor ba la sogs pa re re ni rdzas su yod pa kho nar blta'o //
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa re re ni rdzas su yod pa kho nar blta'o //
translated: Feeling, etc. should be regarded as substantially real, each in its own right.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: tshor ba la sogs pa ni blos bsal nas kyang tshor ba'i rang bzhin gyis blor 'gyur bas tshor ba rdzas su yod pa yin no //
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa ni blos bsal nas kyang tshor ba'i rang bzhin gyis blor 'gyur bas tshor ba rdzas su yod pa yin no //
translated: Feeling is substantially real, because the nature of feeling is not eliminated by the intellect, even when the other factors are eliminated by the intellect.

original: sems pa la sogs pa dag la yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: sems pa la sogs pa dag la yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The same should be applied to intention, etc.

original: de ltar ni don dam pa'i bden pa yin no zhes bya ba la dam pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes te /
analyzed: de ltar ni don dam pa'i bden pa yin no zhes bya ba la dam pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes te /
translated: The ultimate truth is so called because it is the object of the highest knowledge, i.e. supramundane knowledge.

original: de'i don du yul ni don dam pa'o ji ltar 'jig rten pa gzhan gyi 'dzin pa de ltar ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i don du yul ni don dam pa'o ji ltar 'jig rten pa gzhan gyi 'dzin pa de ltar ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa yin no //
translated: The conventional truth is so called because it is the object of the conventional, i.e. mundane knowledge, as it is grasped by others.

original: kun rdzob dang tha snyad du bden pa ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o //üîΩtshul gnas thos dang bsam ldan pa //
analyzed: kun rdzob dang tha snyad du bden pa ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o // tshul gnas thos dang bsam ldan pa //
translated: The conventional truth is the truth of the conventional, i.e. the truth of the conventional designation.üîΩOne who is established in morality, who is endowed with learning and reflection,

original: bsgom pa la ni rab tu sbyor //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bsgom pa la ni rab tu sbyor // zhes bya ba la /
translated: is devoted to meditation.

original: tshul ni tshul khrims te /
analyzed: tshul ni tshul khrims te /
translated: Here, morality is the moral vow.

original: de ni mi g-yeng ba'i rgyu dang / rten gyi rgyu yin no //
analyzed: de ni mi g-yeng ba'i rgyu dang / rten gyi rgyu yin no //
translated: It is the cause of non-distraction and the cause of the basis.

original: thos pa ni mi rmongs pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: thos pa ni mi rmongs pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: Learning is the cause of non-delusion.

original: bsam pa ni gtan la phebs pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: bsam pa ni gtan la phebs pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: Reflection is the cause of ascertainment.

original: bsgom pa ni bral ba'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa ni bral ba'i rgyu'o //
translated: Cultivation is the cause of separation.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang /
translated: The Lord has said:

original: dge slong brtun cing rtag 'grus pa //
analyzed: dge slong brtun cing rtag 'grus pa //
translated: The monk who is energetic and always persevering,

original: tshul khrims yang dag blangs byas nas //
analyzed: tshul khrims yang dag blangs byas nas //
translated: having taken up the precepts of morality,

original: sems dang shes rab sgom byed pas //
analyzed: sems dang shes rab sgom byed pas //
translated: cultivating the mind and wisdom,

original: sdug bsngal zad pa 'thob par 'gyur //üîΩzhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal zad pa 'thob par 'gyur // zhes gsungs so //
translated: attains the end of suffering.

original: de skad du yang tshul khrims la brten cing tshul khrims la gnas te chos gnyis bsgom par bya'o zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de skad du yang tshul khrims la brten cing tshul khrims la gnas te chos gnyis bsgom par bya'o zhes gsungs te /
translated: And it is said: ‚ÄúRelying on morality, abiding in morality, one should cultivate two dharmas.

original: des na thog ma kho nar tshul khrims dag la shin tu gus par byed par bya dgos so 'dir ni so sor thar pa'i tshul khrims kyi sdom pa mngon par 'dod kyi bsam gtan dang zag pa med pa'i bdag nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: des na thog ma kho nar tshul khrims dag la shin tu gus par byed par bya dgos so 'dir ni so sor thar pa'i tshul khrims kyi sdom pa mngon par 'dod kyi bsam gtan dang zag pa med pa'i bdag nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: ‚Äù Therefore, one must first of all generate great respect for the pure moralities. Here, the vow of individual liberation morality is intended, not that of the meditative absorptions and the uncontaminated.

original: de'i 'og tu bden pa mthong ba dang / mthun pa'i thos pa ni 'dzin pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu bden pa mthong ba dang / mthun pa'i thos pa ni 'dzin pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Then, after that, the hearing that is in conformity with the seeing of the truths is called ‚Äúgrasping.‚Äù

original: thos pa dang ldan pa'i bsgom pa rdzogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: thos pa dang ldan pa'i bsgom pa rdzogs par 'gyur te /
translated: The meditation that is endowed with hearing is completed.üîΩIt is said in verse:

original: thos nas chos rnams shes 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: thos nas chos rnams shes 'gyur zhing //
translated: One comes to know the teachings through hearing.

original: thos nas sdig pa ldog par 'gyur //
analyzed: thos nas sdig pa ldog par 'gyur //
translated: Through hearing, one turns away from evil.

original: thos nas dus min gtong ba ste //
analyzed: thos nas dus min gtong ba ste //
translated: Through hearing, one abandons untimely actions.

original: thos nas mya ngan 'das pa 'thob //üîΩces tshigs su bcad de 'byung ba'i phyir ro //üîΩthams cad thos pa dang ldan zhes te /
analyzed: thos nas mya ngan 'das pa 'thob // ces tshigs su bcad de 'byung ba'i phyir ro // thams cad thos pa dang ldan zhes te /
translated: Through hearing, one attains nirvana.

original: bsgom pa la sbyor ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: bsgom pa la sbyor ba ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not that everyone who has hearing is engaged in meditation.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang mthun pa'i chos mang du thos pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang mthun pa'i chos mang du thos pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is that one has heard much of the teachings that are in conformity with the truths of the noble ones.

original: de skad du yang btsun pa dge @156a * //üîΩslong mang du thos ba zhes bgyi na /üîΩji ltar na dge slong mang du thos pa lags /
analyzed: de skad du yang btsun pa dge @156a * // slong mang du thos ba zhes bgyi na / ji ltar na dge slong mang du thos pa lags /
translated: The Venerable One said this:üîΩ‚ÄúWhen it is said, ‚ÄòA monk has heard much,‚ÄôüîΩhow is it that a monk has heard much?

original: ji tsam gyis na de bzhin gshegs pas dge slong mang du thos par 'dogs shing 'dogs par mdzad /
analyzed: ji tsam gyis na de bzhin gshegs pas dge slong mang du thos par 'dogs shing 'dogs par mdzad /
translated: To what extent does the Tathagata designate and declare a monk to be one who has heard much?‚Äù

original: dge slong dge slong gi gzugs la skyo ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang 'gog par bya ba'i phyir chos thos par gyur cing /
analyzed: dge slong dge slong gi gzugs la skyo ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang 'gog par bya ba'i phyir chos thos par gyur cing /
translated: Monks who hear the Dharma in order to be disenchanted with the form of a monk, in order to be disenchanted with feeling, discernment, formation, and consciousness, in order to be dispassionate toward them, in order to be freed from them, in order to stop them,

original: dge slong dge slong gi tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa la skyo ba dang 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'gog par bya ba'i phyir chos thos par 'gyur na /
analyzed: dge slong dge slong gi tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa la skyo ba dang 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'gog par bya ba'i phyir chos thos par 'gyur na /
translated: monks who hear the Dharma in order to be disenchanted with the form of a monk, in order to be disenchanted with feeling, discernment, formation, and consciousness, in order to be dispassionate toward them, in order to be freed from them, in order to stop them,

original: dge slong mang du thos pa zhes brjod par nus so //
analyzed: dge slong mang du thos pa zhes brjod par nus so //
translated: can be called monks who have heard much.

original: dge slong de tsam gyis dge slong mang du thos par 'gyur /
analyzed: dge slong de tsam gyis dge slong mang du thos par 'gyur /
translated: Monks, by just that much you become monks who have heard much.

original: de tsam gyis de bzhin gshegs pas dge slong mang du thos par 'dogs shing /
analyzed: de tsam gyis de bzhin gshegs pas dge slong mang du thos par 'dogs shing /
translated: Monks, by just that much the TathƒÅgata designates you as monks who have heard much,

original: 'dogs phar mdzad do zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dogs phar mdzad do zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: and he does designate you as such.‚Äù

original: slob dpon gyis kyang de'i 'og tu bden pa mthong ba dang mthun pa'i thos pa 'dzin pa'am /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis kyang de'i 'og tu bden pa mthong ba dang mthun pa'i thos pa 'dzin pa'am /
translated: The master also says, ‚ÄúAfter that, they retain what they have heard that accords with seeing the truths,

original: don nyan par byed do zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: don nyan par byed do zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: or they listen to the meaning.‚Äù

original: gal te gzhung 'dzin par mi nus na snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: gal te gzhung 'dzin par mi nus na snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: If you think, I am not able to master the texts, you should not give up.

original: bsams pa las byung ba ji ltar gnyi ga la dmigs pa yin pa bstan pa'i phyir nges 'ga' ni yi ges don 'dren par byed do zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: bsams pa las byung ba ji ltar gnyi ga la dmigs pa yin pa bstan pa'i phyir nges 'ga' ni yi ges don 'dren par byed do zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In order to show how the wisdom arisen from thinking has both kinds of objects, he says: Sometimes the meaning is drawn out by the letters.

original: 'dir yi ge ni ming la mngon par 'dod do //
analyzed: 'dir yi ge ni ming la mngon par 'dod do //
translated: Here, letters are considered to be names.

original: de bzhin du res 'ga' ni don gyis yi ge 'dren par byed do zhes bya ba ni ming zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bzhin du res 'ga' ni don gyis yi ge 'dren par byed do zhes bya ba ni ming zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Similarly, sometimes the letters are drawn out by the meaning, which means the name.

original: de ni yi ge la mi ltos par zhes bya ba ni ming la ltos par zhes bya ba'i don gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de ni yi ge la mi ltos par zhes bya ba ni ming la ltos par zhes bya ba'i don gang yin pa'o //
translated: That is, it is not dependent on letters, which means it is dependent on names.

original: yi ge dang lhan cig spyod pas ming la yi ge btags pa'am 'dis don gsal bar byed pas na ming la yi ge zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yi ge dang lhan cig spyod pas ming la yi ge btags pa'am 'dis don gsal bar byed pas na ming la yi ge zhes bya'o //
translated: Because it is used together with letters, the name is designated as letters. Or, because it clarifies the meaning, the name is called letters.

original: slob dpon gyis 'di la ni zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis 'di la ni zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
translated: The Master says:

original: bsams pa las byung ba'i shes rab 'grub par mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: bsams pa las byung ba'i shes rab 'grub par mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: The wisdom arisen from thinking will not be accomplished.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: If you ask, Well then, what is?

original: thos pa dang bsgoms pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: thos pa dang bsgoms pa las byung ba'o //
translated: It is derived from listening and from meditation.

original: yid ches pa'i lung zhes bya ba ni nyes pa zad pa'i tshig ste /
analyzed: yid ches pa'i lung zhes bya ba ni nyes pa zad pa'i tshig ste /
translated: The statement ‚Äúit is a trustworthy scripture‚Äù means that it is a statement that exhausts faults.

original: gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis so //
analyzed: gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis so //
translated: It is the twelve branches of the scriptures.

original: de las skyes pa'i shes rab gang yin pa de ni thos pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: de las skyes pa'i shes rab gang yin pa de ni thos pa las byung ba'o //
translated: The wisdom that arises from that is derived from listening.

original: rigs pas nges par brtag pa ni nges par brtag pa ste /
analyzed: rigs pas nges par brtag pa ni nges par brtag pa ste /
translated: The statement ‚Äúit is a rational postulation‚Äù means that it is a postulation.

original: de las skyes pa ni bsams pa las byung ba'i shes rab bo //
analyzed: de las skyes pa ni bsams pa las byung ba'i shes rab bo //
translated: The wisdom that arises from that is derived from contemplation.

original: bsgoms pa las byung ba ni ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa yin no //
analyzed: bsgoms pa las byung ba ni ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa yin no //
translated: The wisdom that arises from meditation is derived from meditation.

original: bsrings gnyis ldan zhes bya ba ni gang la bsrings shing dben pa mi @156b ldan pa gnyis yod pa de ni bsrings pa gnyis dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: bsrings gnyis ldan zhes bya ba ni gang la bsrings shing dben pa mi @156b ldan pa gnyis yod pa de ni bsrings pa gnyis dang ldan pa ste /
translated: The statement ‚Äúit is endowed with the two separations‚Äù means that it is endowed with the two separations that are the separation from and the separation of the two.

original: bsrings pa gnyis dang ldan pa de'o //
analyzed: bsrings pa gnyis dang ldan pa de'o //
translated: It is endowed with the two separations.

original: ci zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhe na /
translated: What are the two?

original: de'i phyir gal te 'du 'dzi dang mi dge ba'i rnam par rtog pa thag bsrings pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gal te 'du 'dzi dang mi dge ba'i rnam par rtog pa thag bsrings pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚Äúbecause it is a separation from worldly activity and from unwholesome thoughts.‚Äù

original: zla med par gnas pa nyid kyis lus bsrings pa yin la dran pa legs par gnas pas gnas pa nyid kyis mi dge ba'i rnam par rtog pa thag bsrings pa'i phyir sems kyis bsrings pa'o //
analyzed: zla med par gnas pa nyid kyis lus bsrings pa yin la dran pa legs par gnas pas gnas pa nyid kyis mi dge ba'i rnam par rtog pa thag bsrings pa'i phyir sems kyis bsrings pa'o //
translated: It is extended in body because it is extended in the sense of being well-established, and it is extended in mind because it is extended in the sense of being well-established in mindfulness, and because it is far removed from unwholesome thoughts.

original: mi dge pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni 'dod pa dang gnod sems dang rnam par 'tshe ba'i rnam par rtog pa ste /
analyzed: mi dge pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni 'dod pa dang gnod sems dang rnam par 'tshe ba'i rnam par rtog pa ste /
translated: Unwholesome thoughts are thoughts of sensuality, malice, and harmfulness.

original: de dag la mngon du mi phyogs pa ni thag bsrings pa'o //
analyzed: de dag la mngon du mi phyogs pa ni thag bsrings pa'o //
translated: To not be inclined toward them is to be far removed from them.

original: gya nom pa ma yin pa dang mang po ma yin pa rnyed pas yid mi bde ba ni zhes bya ba ni yid mi bde ba ste /
analyzed: gya nom pa ma yin pa dang mang po ma yin pa rnyed pas yid mi bde ba ni zhes bya ba ni yid mi bde ba ste /
translated: It is mental dissatisfaction due to the acquisition of what is not sublime and what is not abundant.üîΩMental dissatisfaction is mental dissatisfaction.

original: des yi mug cing nyams par byas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: des yi mug cing nyams par byas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: It is said that it causes dejection and despair.

original: gya nom pa ma yin pa'i phyir ram mang po ma yin pa'i phyir rnyed pa des yid mi bde ba ni mchog mi shes pa yin la gya nom pa dang mang po ma rnyed pa 'dod cing mngon par 'dod pa ni 'dod chen can yin no zhes bya
analyzed: gya nom pa ma yin pa'i phyir ram mang po ma yin pa'i phyir rnyed pa des yid mi bde ba ni mchog mi shes pa yin la gya nom pa dang mang po ma rnyed pa 'dod cing mngon par 'dod pa ni 'dod chen can yin no zhes bya
translated: Because it is not excellent or not abundant, one who is not satisfied with that gain is one who does not know satisfaction. One who desires and seeks excellent and abundant gain is one who is covetous.

original: ba ni slob dpon gyi lugs so //
analyzed: ba ni slob dpon gyi lugs so //
translated: This is the master's system.

original: 'di gnyis khams gsum gtogs dri med //
analyzed: 'di gnyis khams gsum gtogs dri med //
translated: These two are included in the three realms and are stainless.

original: ces bya ba ni ma chags pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni ma chags pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are by nature roots of virtue that are nonattachment.

original: chog mi shes pa dang 'dod chen can ni 'dod pa na spyod pa dag kho na yin no zhes bya ba ni chags pa ni mi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chog mi shes pa dang 'dod chen can ni 'dod pa na spyod pa dag kho na yin no zhes bya ba ni chags pa ni mi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Those who are not satisfied and are covetous are only those who experience the desire realm.

original: 'phags pa'i rigs nye bar 'god pa'i 'brel pa gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i rigs nye bar 'god pa'i 'brel pa gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the connection that establishes the noble lineages?

original: 'di ltar sbyangs pa'i yon tan la gnas pa'i bsgom pa rdzogs par 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'di ltar sbyangs pa'i yon tan la gnas pa'i bsgom pa rdzogs par 'gyur la /
translated: Thus, one who abides in the qualities of training completes meditation.

original: sbyangs pa'i yon tan rnams kyang 'phags pa'i rigs kyis bsdus pas so //
analyzed: sbyangs pa'i yon tan rnams kyang 'phags pa'i rigs kyis bsdus pas so //
translated: The virtues of purification are also included in the spiritual lineages of the ƒÅryas.

original: gzhan yang 'dod chen chung ba dang / chog shes pa ni sbyangs pa'i yon tan la gnas pa kho na la yod kyi /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'dod chen chung ba dang / chog shes pa ni sbyangs pa'i yon tan la gnas pa kho na la yod kyi /
translated: Moreover, the absence of great desire and contentment exist only for those who abide in the virtues of purification.

original: gzhan la ma yin pas de gnyis kyi rab tu dbye ba 'phags pa'i rigs dag gi sgo nas bstan to //
analyzed: gzhan la ma yin pas de gnyis kyi rab tu dbye ba 'phags pa'i rigs dag gi sgo nas bstan to //
translated: They do not exist for others. Therefore, their classification is presented from the perspective of the spiritual lineages of the ƒÅryas.üîΩThe delight in relinquishment and meditative development.

original: spong ba dang bsgom pa la dga' ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba la spong ba dang bsgom pa ni spong ba dang bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: spong ba dang bsgom pa la dga' ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba la spong ba dang bsgom pa ni spong ba dang bsgom pa'o //
translated: Relinquishment and meditative development are relinquishment and meditative development.

original: de la dga' ba ni spong ba dang bsgom pa la dga' ba'o //üîΩ'di la dga' bas na dga' ba ste /
analyzed: de la dga' ba ni spong ba dang bsgom pa la dga' ba'o // 'di la dga' bas na dga' ba ste /
translated: Delight in them is delight in relinquishment and meditative development.

original: de'i dngos po ni spong ba dang bsgom pa la dga' ba nyid do //
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni spong ba dang bsgom pa la dga' ba nyid do //
translated: One who delights in this is one who delights in relinquishment and meditative development.

original: spong ba dang bsgom pa zhes bya ba ni bral ba dang lam mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: spong ba dang bsgom pa zhes bya ba ni bral ba dang lam mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Relinquishment and meditative development refer to the path of relinquishment and the path of meditative development.

original: yang na spong ba'i ched du bsgom pa ni spong ba'i bsgom pa yin la /
analyzed: yang na spong ba'i ched du bsgom pa ni spong ba'i bsgom pa yin la /
translated: Alternatively, meditative development for the sake of relinquishment is meditative development for relinquishment.

original: spong ba'i bsgom pa la dga' ba ni spong @157a * //
analyzed: spong ba'i bsgom pa la dga' ba ni spong @157a * //
translated: Delight in meditation on elimination is the delight in the elimination of defilements and suffering.üîΩ

original: ba'i bsgom pa la dga' ba ste /
analyzed: ba'i bsgom pa la dga' ba ste /
translated: Delight in the cultivation of abandonment is delight in the cultivation of abandonment.üîΩIt is the cultivation of the means of realizing the cessation of the defilements.

original: nyon mongs pa'i 'gog pa mngon sum du bya ba'i thabs la goms pa lhur len zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i 'gog pa mngon sum du bya ba'i thabs la goms pa lhur len zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning of ‚Äúendeavoring in the cultivation of the means of realizing the cessation of the defilements.‚ÄùüîΩBecause of turning away from existence and attachment to the desire realm,

original: srid pa dang 'dod pa'i 'dod chags la rgyab kyis phyogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni srid pa la rgyab kyis phyogs pa'i phyir dang / 'dod pa'i 'dod chags la rgyab kyis phyogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: srid pa dang 'dod pa'i 'dod chags la rgyab kyis phyogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni srid pa la rgyab kyis phyogs pa'i phyir dang / 'dod pa'i 'dod chags la rgyab kyis phyogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: means turning away from existence and turning away from attachment to the desire realm.

original: rang gi tshul dang las kyi mtha' yongs su spangs shing zhes bya ba ni rang gi tshul yongs su spangs pa dang / rang gi las kyi mtha' yongs su spangs ba'o //
analyzed: rang gi tshul dang las kyi mtha' yongs su spangs shing zhes bya ba ni rang gi tshul yongs su spangs pa dang / rang gi las kyi mtha' yongs su spangs ba'o //
translated: Abandoning one‚Äôs own way and livelihood means abandoning one‚Äôs own way and abandoning one‚Äôs own livelihood.

original: de la gang gis 'tsho ba de ni tshul te /
analyzed: de la gang gis 'tsho ba de ni tshul te /
translated: Therein, what one lives by is one‚Äôs way.

original: zas dang / skom dang bgo ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zas dang / skom dang bgo ba la sogs pa'o //

analyzed: sngar bskyed pa ni lha rnams kyi nang du mngon du byed pa yin no //
translated: But that previously generated is actualized among the gods.üîΩIt focuses on its own time.

original: dus gang yin pa'i de'i dus la dmigs so zhes bya ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pa bzhin du 'das pa'i dmigs pa ni 'das pa yin pa nas de bzhin du da ltar byung ba'i dmigs pa da ltar byung ba'i par du yin no /
analyzed: dus gang yin pa'i de'i dus la dmigs so zhes bya ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pa bzhin du 'das pa'i dmigs pa ni 'das pa yin pa nas de bzhin du da ltar byung ba'i dmigs pa da ltar byung ba'i par du yin no /
translated: Like eye consciousness, the object of its focal object is past when it is past, and so on, up to present when it is present.

original: ma skye ba'i chos can gyi yul ni dus gsum yin no //
analyzed: ma skye ba'i chos can gyi yul ni dus gsum yin no //
translated: The object of a nonarisen dharma is the three times.

original: ma 'ongs pa ni gdon mi za bar 'byung ba ma yin la /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa ni gdon mi za bar 'byung ba ma yin la /
translated: The future is not necessarily to be produced,

original: nges par yod pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: nges par yod pa yang ma yin no //
translated: nor is it necessarily existent.

original: de ni gzugs kyi skye mched kyi dmigs pa la nges pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de ni gzugs kyi skye mched kyi dmigs pa la nges pa yin gyi /
translated: This is the determination of the object-field of the form base;

original: rdzas dang dus kyi skad cig la nges pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rdzas dang dus kyi skad cig la nges pa ma yin no //
translated: it is not the determination of the moment of substance and time.

original: mos pa yid la byed pa yin pa'i phyir zag pa dang bcas pa yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mos pa yid la byed pa yin pa'i phyir zag pa dang bcas pa yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is associated with the outflows because it is attention that is aspiration.

original: zag pa med pa ni de kho na yid la byed pa yin no //
analyzed: zag pa med pa ni de kho na yid la byed pa yin no //
translated: The uncontaminated is attention that is reality.

original: 'dris pa dang ma 'dris pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la 'dris pa ni 'dod chags dang bral bas thob pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dris pa dang ma 'dris pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la 'dris pa ni 'dod chags dang bral bas thob pa yin no //
translated: It is familiar and unfamiliar. That which is familiar is obtained through detachment.

original: ma 'dris pa ni sbyor ba las byung ba yin no //
analyzed: ma 'dris pa ni sbyor ba las byung ba yin no //
translated: That which is unfamiliar is obtained through practice.

original: so so'i skye bo'i rgyud la yod pa ni thog ma med pa can gyi 'khor ba na 'dris pa'i phyir 'dod chags dang bral bas 'thob pa'o //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo'i rgyud la yod pa ni thog ma med pa can gyi 'khor ba na 'dris pa'i phyir 'dod chags dang bral bas 'thob pa'o //
translated: That which exists in the stream of an ordinary person is obtained through detachment because it is familiar in beginningless cyclic existence.

original: 'phags pa'i rgyud la yod pa ni ma 'dris pa'i phyir sbyor ba las byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i rgyud la yod pa ni ma 'dris pa'i phyir sbyor ba las byung ba'o //
translated: That which exists in the stream of being of a noble one is derived from preparation, because it is not familiar.

original: dbugs rngub dbugs 'byung zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: dbugs rngub dbugs 'byung zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: In-breathing and out-breathing, etc.

original: de gnyis zhes bya ba ni dbugs rngub pa dang / dbugs 'byung ba gnyis so //
analyzed: de gnyis zhes bya ba ni dbugs rngub pa dang / dbugs 'byung ba gnyis so //
translated: Those two means in-breathing and out-breathing.

original: de dag la dmigs pa'i dran pa ni dbugs rngub pa dang 'byung ba dran pa'o //üîΩdran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhin te zhes bya ba la ji ltar shes rab kyi rang bzhin yin bzhin du dran pa'i stobs skyed par 'jug pa'i phyir lus la sogs pa dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dag tu brjod pa de bzhin du dbugs rngub pa dang
analyzed: de dag la dmigs pa'i dran pa ni dbugs rngub pa dang 'byung ba dran pa'o // dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhin te zhes bya ba la ji ltar shes rab kyi rang bzhin yin bzhin du dran pa'i stobs skyed par 'jug pa'i phyir lus la sogs pa dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dag tu brjod pa de bzhin du dbugs rngub pa dang
translated: The mindfulness that has them as its object is mindfulness of in-breathing and out-breathing.üîΩJust as the applications of mindfulness are to the body, etc.

original: 'byung ba dran pa shes rab kyi rang bzhin yin bzhin du dran pa'i stobs skyed pas 'jug pa'i phyir dbugs rngub dang 'byung ba dran pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba dran pa shes rab kyi rang bzhin yin bzhin du dran pa'i stobs skyed pas 'jug pa'i phyir dbugs rngub dang 'byung ba dran pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Just as the applications of mindfulness to the body, etc. are described as the applications of mindfulness, although they are by nature wisdom, because they function to generate the power of mindfulness, so too mindfulness of in-breathing and out-breathing is described as mindfulness of in-breathing and out-breathing, although it is by nature wisdom, because it functions to generate the power of mindfulness.

original: shes rab kyis ni chos rnams sdom par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyis ni chos rnams sdom par byed pa yin no //
translated: Wisdom is the fetter of dharmas.

original: nyer bsdogs gsum zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa dang gsum pa'i nyer bsdogs dag go //
analyzed: nyer bsdogs gsum zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa dang gsum pa'i nyer bsdogs dag go //
translated: The three access concentrations are the access concentrations of the first, second, and third absorptions.

original: ci'i phyir dngos gzhi dag na ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir dngos gzhi dag na ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why are they not in the actual absorptions?

original: btang snyoms dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: btang snyoms dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are associated with equanimity.

original: 'di ltar bsam gtan dang po'i nyer bsdogs la sogs pa dag na tshor ba btang snyoms yod la /
analyzed: 'di ltar bsam gtan dang po'i nyer bsdogs la sogs pa dag na tshor ba btang snyoms yod la /
translated: Thus, in the access concentrations of the first absorption, etc., there is the feeling of equanimity.üîΩBut in the access concentration of the fourth absorption, there is no inhalation and exhalation.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa'i nyer bsdogs na dbugs rngub pa dang / 'byung ba yod pa ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa'i nyer bsdogs na dbugs rngub pa dang / 'byung ba yod pa ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: Why is it that the access concentration of the fourth absorption is not called a station of mastery?üîΩBecause it is associated with equanimity alone.üîΩWhy is it that the other access concentrations are not called stations of mastery?üîΩBecause they are not associated with equanimity alone.üîΩWhy is it that the actual absorptions are not called stations of mastery?üîΩBecause they are associated with investigation.üîΩWhy is it that the special meditative development is not called a station of mastery?üîΩBecause it is associated with the faculty of equanimity.üîΩWhy is it that the summit of existence is not called a station of mastery?üîΩBecause it is associated with the faculty of neither-discomfort-nor-pleasure.

original: yang ci'i phyir @159a * //
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir @159a * //
translated: Why is it that the other stations are not called stations of mastery?

original: 'di ltar btang snyoms dang mtshungs par ldan pa nyid kho nar nges par gzung zhe na de'i phyir /üîΩrnam par rtog pa dang mthun pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: 'di ltar btang snyoms dang mtshungs par ldan pa nyid kho nar nges par gzung zhe na de'i phyir /üîΩrnam par rtog pa dang mthun pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Because they are not associated with the faculty of equanimity alone.

original: de'i gnyen po ni zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen po dbugs rngub pa 'byung ba dran pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de'i gnyen po ni zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen po dbugs rngub pa 'byung ba dran pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The antidote to that is the mindfulness of inhalation and exhalation, which has the nature of an antidote to discursive thought.

original: de dag dang mtshungs par mi ldan no zhes bya ba ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal dag dang ngo //
analyzed: de dag dang mtshungs par mi ldan no zhes bya ba ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal dag dang ngo //
translated: It is not associated with pleasure and pain.

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa'i yid ba de ba dang / bsam gtan gsum pa'i bde ba rtogs pa med pa dang mtshungs par ldan par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa'i yid ba de ba dang / bsam gtan gsum pa'i bde ba rtogs pa med pa dang mtshungs par ldan par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: It is associated with the pleasure of the second meditative absorption and the non-discursive pleasure of the third meditative absorption.

original: de'i phyir bde ba dang yid bde ba dag kyang gtod pa la bar chad byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te //
analyzed: de'i phyir bde ba dang yid bde ba dag kyang gtod pa la bar chad byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te //
translated: Therefore, he says, pleasure and mental pleasure also obstruct the directing of the mind.üîΩBecause they are enemies of tranquility,

original: gzo ba'i dgra yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don dang / dbugs rngub pa dang 'byung ba de yang gtod pas bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzo ba'i dgra yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don dang / dbugs rngub pa dang 'byung ba de yang gtod pas bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: and because inhalation and exhalation are to be accomplished through directing the mind,

original: gzo bas bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzo bas bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: because they are to be accomplished through tranquility.üîΩThe mindfulness of inhalation and exhalation is not associated with the five sensory consciousnesses, because it is associated with the mental faculty.

original: dbugs rngub pa dang 'byung ba dran pa ni gzo bas bsgrub par bya ba yin la /üîΩdbugs rngub pa dang 'byung ba bsdoms pa dang / gtod pa dang / gzo ba dang / lhur len pa zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs so //üîΩde dag gi ltar nas brgyad pa yin no zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan gsum gyi sa pa gzung ste /üîΩyan chad ni dbugs rngub pa dang / 'byung ba'i sa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'dod pa'i khams kyi rten can yin te zhes bya ba ni de na rtog pa mang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbugs rngub pa dang 'byung ba dran pa ni gzo bas bsgrub par bya ba yin la / dbugs rngub pa dang 'byung ba bsdoms pa dang / gtod pa dang / gzo ba dang / lhur len pa zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs so // de dag gi ltar nas brgyad pa yin no zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan gsum gyi sa pa gzung ste / yan chad ni dbugs rngub pa dang / 'byung ba'i sa ma yin pa'i phyir ro // 'dod pa'i khams kyi rten can yin te zhes bya ba ni de na rtog pa mang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Mindfulness of inhalation and exhalation is to be practiced by one who is diligent.

original: sbyor ba las 'byung ba ni sbyor bas thob pa yin la /üîΩ'dod chags dang bral bas thob pa ni 'dod chags dang bral bas thob pa yin no //üîΩchos 'di pa rnams kho na'i yin gyi zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas pa rnams kho na'i yin gyi zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /

original: phyi pa'i ni ma yin te /
analyzed: phyi pa'i ni ma yin te /
translated: They are not outsiders,

analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir dang / zab pa'i phyir ro //

translated: The three natures are profound because they are not known by themselves.üîΩThe three natures are profound because they are not known by themselves.

original: skye ba la sngar 'jug la /
analyzed: skye ba la sngar 'jug la /
translated: The three natures are profound because they are not known

original: 'chi ba la phyis 'byung ngo zhes de ltar skye ba dang / 'chi ba rtogs pa las mi rtag pa la 'dris par byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'chi ba la phyis 'byung ngo zhes de ltar skye ba dang / 'chi ba rtogs pa las mi rtag pa la 'dris par byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, through the realization of birth and death, one becomes familiar with impermanence.

original: rlung gi dkyil 'khor dang zhes bya ba ni 'og tu rjes su 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: rlung gi dkyil 'khor dang zhes bya ba ni 'og tu rjes su 'gro ba'o //
translated: The wind-disk and so on is the downward movement.

original: 'thor byed kyi rlung gi bar zhes bya ba ni gyen du rjes su 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: 'thor byed kyi rlung gi bar zhes bya ba ni gyen du rjes su 'gro ba'o //
translated: Up to the scattering wind is the upward movement.

original: de kho na yid la byed pa'i phyir mi rigs so zhes bya ba ni rlung gi dkyil 'khor dang rnam par 'thor byed kyi rlung gi bar du'o zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de kho na yid la byed pa'i phyir mi rigs so zhes bya ba ni rlung gi dkyil 'khor dang rnam par 'thor byed kyi rlung gi bar du'o zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It is not reasonable to attend to that, because the wind-disk and so on up to the scattering wind are not the object of the mindfulness of breathing.

original: dbugs rngub pa dang 'byung ba ni de ltar ring bar mi rgyu ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbugs rngub pa dang 'byung ba ni de ltar ring bar mi rgyu ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because inhalation and exhalation do not move that far.

original: ci phan 'dogs par byed pa zhig gam /üîΩgnod par byed pa zhig gam /
analyzed: ci phan 'dogs par byed pa zhig gam / gnod par byed pa zhig gam /
translated: Is it beneficial or harmful?

original: grang ngam dro ba dag cig ces bya ba 'byung ngo //
analyzed: grang ngam dro ba dag cig ces bya ba 'byung ngo //
translated: Is it cold or warm?

original: de dag la brten la sems dang sems las byung ba dag ces bya ba ni de la rag ste 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de dag la brten la sems dang sems las byung ba dag ces bya ba ni de la rag ste 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase in dependence on those, the mind and mental factors means that they are dependent on those and engage in them.

original: chos kyi mchog gi bar du zhes bya bas ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa nas bzung ste zhes ston to //
analyzed: chos kyi mchog gi bar du zhes bya bas ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa nas bzung ste zhes ston to //
translated: The phrase up to the supreme mundane state indicates that they are from the stage of the applications of mindfulness.

original: mthong ba'i lam la sogs pa la 'jug pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba smos pa ni bsgom pa dang mi slob pa'i lam gzung bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam la sogs pa la 'jug pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba smos pa ni bsgom pa dang mi slob pa'i lam gzung bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase they enter the path of seeing and so on indicates that the path of meditation and the path of no-more-learning are included by the word and so on.

original: rnam par dag pa ni zad pa shes pa la sogs pa yin no zhes bya ba la 'dir yang sogs pa zhes bya ba smos pas mi skye ba shes pa dang / mi slob pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba gzung ste /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa ni zad pa shes pa la sogs pa yin no zhes bya ba la 'dir yang sogs pa zhes bya ba smos pas mi skye ba shes pa dang / mi slob pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba gzung ste /
translated: The phrase purification is the knowledge of destruction and so on indicates that the knowledge of non-arising and the correct view of the adept are included by the word and so on.

original: gos dri ma dang 'brel pa ltar dag pa med pas lhag ma dang bcas pa ni dag pa yin par mi 'os pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gos dri ma dang 'brel pa ltar dag pa med pas lhag ma dang bcas pa ni dag pa yin par mi 'os pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not proper for purification to be incomplete, like a garment that is not free from stains.

original: lus sa gang ba yin pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa na spyod pa nas bsam gtan gsum pa'i sa pa'i bar te /
analyzed: lus sa gang ba yin pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa na spyod pa nas bsam gtan gsum pa'i sa pa'i bar te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúit is the body that is pervaded‚Äù means that it is the body that is pervaded from the realm of desire up to the third meditative absorption.

original: dbugs rngub pa dang 'byung ba ni de dag gis pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: dbugs rngub pa dang 'byung ba ni de dag gis pa kho na yin te /

original: gzhan gyi sa pa ni snyoms par zhugs pa'i dmigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sa pa ni snyoms par zhugs pa'i dmigs pa ma yin no //
translated: The meditative development of the recollection of inhalation and exhalation is not concerned with the realms that are other than these.

original: lus kyi phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rang gi lus kyi phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir zhes bya bar bsams pa ste /
analyzed: lus kyi phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rang gi lus kyi phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir zhes bya bar bsams pa ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause it is a part of the body‚Äù is intended to mean: because it is a part of one‚Äôs own body.

original: 'di ltar dbugs rngub pa dang dbugs 'byung ba dran pa ni rang gi lus kyi dbugs rngub pa dang / dbugs 'byung ba la dmigs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar dbugs rngub pa dang dbugs 'byung ba dran pa ni rang gi lus kyi dbugs rngub pa dang / dbugs 'byung ba la dmigs pa yin gyi /
translated: Thus, the recollection of inhalation and exhalation is concerned with the inhalation and exhalation of one‚Äôs own body.

original: gzhan gyi lus kyi dbugs rngub pa dang dbugs 'byung ba la dmigs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi lus kyi dbugs rngub pa dang dbugs 'byung ba la dmigs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not concerned with the inhalation and exhalation of another‚Äôs body.

original: lus dang sems khyad par can la brten nas zhes bya ba 'byung ngo //
analyzed: lus dang sems khyad par can la brten nas zhes bya ba 'byung ngo //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúit is based upon a special body and mind‚Äù is supplied.

original: gzugs med pa na nur nur po la sogs par gyur pa rnams la med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la gzugs med pa rnams la ni re zhig gzugs nyid yod pa ma yin pas lus la brten pa smos so //
analyzed: gzugs med pa na nur nur po la sogs par gyur pa rnams la med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la gzugs med pa rnams la ni re zhig gzugs nyid yod pa ma yin pas lus la brten pa smos so //
translated: In the formless realm, form does not exist at all, so the root text specifies that the breath is based on the body.

original: nur nur po la sogs @160a * //üîΩpar gyur pa rnams la lus yod mod kyi /
analyzed: nur nur po la sogs @160a * // par gyur pa rnams la lus yod mod kyi /
translated: The embryonic states of kalala, etc.

original: sbubs can ma yin pas lus khyad par can la brten pa smos so //üîΩsems med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i sa la snyoms par zhugs pa rnams la /
analyzed: sbubs can ma yin pas lus khyad par can la brten pa smos so // sems med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i sa la snyoms par zhugs pa rnams la /
translated: do exist in the formless realm, but they are not enclosed in a womb, so the root text specifies that the breath is based on a special body.

original: sems nyid yod pa ma yin pa sems la brten ba smos so //üîΩbsam gtan bzhi pa la snyoms par zhugs pa rnams la sems yod mod kyi /
analyzed: sems nyid yod pa ma yin pa sems la brten ba smos so // bsam gtan bzhi pa la snyoms par zhugs pa rnams la sems yod mod kyi /
translated: The breath does not exist for those who are absorbed in the mindless meditative attainments, so the root text specifies that the breath is based on the mind.

original: dbugs rngub pa dang 'byung pa'i rten ma yin pas sems khyad par can la brten pa smos te /
analyzed: dbugs rngub pa dang 'byung pa'i rten ma yin pas sems khyad par can la brten pa smos te /
translated: The mind does exist for those absorbed in the fourth meditative absorption, but it is not the basis of inhalation and exhalation, so the root text specifies that the breath is based on a special mind.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gal te lus kyang sbubs yod pa yin la /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gal te lus kyang sbubs yod pa yin la /
translated: For that very reason, the root text asks, ‚ÄúIf the body is enclosed in a womb,‚Äù and so on.

original: dbugs rngub pa dang dbugs 'byung ba'i sa pa'i sems kyang mngon sum du gyur na /
analyzed: dbugs rngub pa dang dbugs 'byung ba'i sa pa'i sems kyang mngon sum du gyur na /
translated: The mind of the stage of inhalation and exhalation is also manifest.

original: de ltar na 'jug go zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de ltar na 'jug go zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Thus, it is said, ‚Äúit enters in this way.‚Äù

original: skye ba zhes bya ba ni mngal nas 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: skye ba zhes bya ba ni mngal nas 'byung ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBirth‚Äù means emerging from the womb.

original: sems can zhes bya ba ni thob pa dang ma thob pa dang ldan pa'i phyir dang / rgyud du sgro btags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can zhes bya ba ni thob pa dang ma thob pa dang ldan pa'i phyir dang / rgyud du sgro btags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúSentient being‚Äù means endowed with obtainment and non-obtainment, and designated as a continuum.

original: rgyu mthun las byung zhes bya ba ni skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyus bskyed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rgyu mthun las byung zhes bya ba ni skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyus bskyed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúArisen from natural outflow‚Äù means generated by a homogeneous cause.

original: lus rgyas par 'grib par 'gyur ba'i phyir rgyas pa las byung ba ma yin la /
analyzed: lus rgyas par 'grib par 'gyur ba'i phyir rgyas pa las byung ba ma yin la /
translated: It is not arisen from enhancement because the body is diminished as it grows.

original: chad nas nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i phyir rnam par smin pa las skyes pa ma yin no //
analyzed: chad nas nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i phyir rnam par smin pa las skyes pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not arisen from karmic maturation because it links to a new birth after death.

original: rnam par smin pa'i gzugs la ni de lta bu med do zhes bya ba ni bcad nas yang nyid mtshams 'byor pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i gzugs la ni de lta bu med do zhes bya ba ni bcad nas yang nyid mtshams 'byor pa'o //
translated: Such a thing does not exist for form that is karmic maturation, because it is not severed and then reconnected.

original: 'og ma'i yid kyis de nyid mi rtogs so zhes bya ba la 'dod pa'i khams su skyes pa ni sems bzhis rtogs la /
analyzed: 'og ma'i yid kyis de nyid mi rtogs so zhes bya ba la 'dod pa'i khams su skyes pa ni sems bzhis rtogs la /

original: bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa dang gsum pa'i sa pa rnams ni go rims bzhin du sems gsum dang gnyis dang gcig gis rtogs so //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa dang gsum pa'i sa pa rnams ni go rims bzhin du sems gsum dang gnyis dang gcig gis rtogs so //
translated: Those of the first, second and third absorption levels comprehend it through three, two and one mind respectively.

original: sa 'og ma'i sprul pa'i sems ni bsam gtan dang por skyes pa la sogs pas mngon du byed la spyod lam pa'i sems ni bsam gtan gnyis par skyes pas mngon du byed pas de'i phyir 'og ma'i spyod lam pa dang / sprul pa'i sems kyis mi rtogs so zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: sa 'og ma'i sprul pa'i sems ni bsam gtan dang por skyes pa la sogs pas mngon du byed la spyod lam pa'i sems ni bsam gtan gnyis par skyes pas mngon du byed pas de'i phyir 'og ma'i spyod lam pa dang / sprul pa'i sems kyis mi rtogs so zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The emanation mind of a lower level is manifested by one born in the first absorption and so on. The mind governing demeanor is manifested by one born in the second absorption. Therefore it is said that the mind governing demeanor and the emanation mind of a lower level do not comprehend it.

original: de ltar yin dang re zhig sprul pa dang spyod lam pa'i sems 'og ma pas gong mar skyes pas mngon du byed pa gang yin pa des kyang mi rtogs na dge ba dang nyon mongs pa gzhan gyis lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: de ltar yin dang re zhig sprul pa dang spyod lam pa'i sems 'og ma pas gong mar skyes pas mngon du byed pa gang yin pa des kyang mi rtogs na dge ba dang nyon mongs pa gzhan gyis lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: If that is so, then the emanation mind and the mind governing demeanor of a lower level that are manifested by one born in a higher level do not comprehend it. What need is there to mention other virtuous minds and afflicted minds?

original: 'jug pa'i sgo gnyis bshad zin to zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i sgo gnyis bshad zin to zhes bya ba ni /

original: de la 'jug pa mi sdug dang // dbugs rngub 'byung ba dran pa yis //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la 'jug pa mi sdug dang // dbugs rngub 'byung ba dran pa yis // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The two doors of entry are the mindfulness of inhalation and exhalation and the meditation on the impurities.

original: de gnyis kyi ting nge 'dzin thob nas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de gnyis kyi ting nge 'dzin thob nas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Having attained concentration through those two,

analyzed: mi sdug pa dang / dbugs rngub pa dang 'byung @160b bas ting nge 'dzin thob nas so //

original: zhi gnas grub par gyur pa yis //
analyzed: zhi gnas grub par gyur pa yis //

original: zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin grub pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin grub pa'o //

analyzed: lhag mthong bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir // zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: shes rab bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir // zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

analyzed: ting nge 'dzin skyes kyang shes rab med par nyon mongs pa spong ba ma yin te /

analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams ni ye shes kyis gzhom par bya ba yin no zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgoms pas lhag mthong 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di ga las she na /
translated: Where is this taught?

original: mdo las te /
analyzed: mdo las te /
translated: In the sutras,

analyzed: dge slong dag bgrod pa gcig pa'i lam ni 'di yin te /
translated: for it is said, ‚ÄúMonks, this is the one path to be trodden,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: namely,

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams so ;
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams so ;
translated: the four foundations of mindfulness.

original: / dge ba'i phung po ma 'dres pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: / dge ba'i phung po ma 'dres pa ni 'di yin te /

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /

analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: the four foundations of mindfulness.üîΩTheir intrinsic nature is their own nature.

analyzed: de dag gi rang gi mtshan nyid ni rang gi ngo bo'o zhes bya ba la de dag gi rang gi mtshan nyid ni zhes bya ba ni lus la sogs pa de dag gi ste /

analyzed: 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa nyid dang / nyams su myong ba nyid la sogs pa'o //

analyzed: lus kyi sgra ni dbang po la sogs pa dag pa la yang 'jug pas de'i phyir 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa nyid do zhes bya ba smos so //

analyzed: shes rab kyi 'grel pa dang dmigs pa'i dngos po la mi ltos par rang bzhin gyi dran pa nye bar gzhag pa yin par brjod do //

analyzed: thos sogs las byung ba'o zhes bya ba ni / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams sbyor ba las byung ba yin pa'i phyir /

analyzed: zhes bya ba la ci zhe na /

analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya ste /

original: 'brel pa las dang / dmigs pa las so //
analyzed: 'brel pa las dang / dmigs pa las so //

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /

analyzed: gzhan de dang lhan cig 'byung ba zhes bya ba smos te /

analyzed: shes rab dang lhan cig 'byung ba 'du shes la sogs pa rnams so //

original: sems dang tshor ba la sogs pa @161a * //
analyzed: sems dang tshor ba la sogs pa @161a * //

original: rnams so zhes ci ste ma smras she na /
analyzed: rnams so zhes ci ste ma smras she na /

original: sems dang tshor ba gnyis ni dmigs pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pas bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems dang tshor ba gnyis ni dmigs pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pas bsdus pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: ji ltar gzhan dag la 'brel pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa brjod ce na /

original: mdo las te /
analyzed: mdo las te /
translated: Because of the S≈´tra.

analyzed: dge slong dag chos thams cad ces bya ba 'di ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi'i tshig bla dags so zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Monks, this is called the four foundations of mindfulness, which is a term for all dharmas.

original: 'brel pas dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni 'brel pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ste /
analyzed: 'brel pas dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni 'brel pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ste /
translated: The foundation of mindfulness that is related is the foundation of mindfulness that is related to the foundation of mindfulness that is natural.

analyzed: rang bzhin gyi dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is related to the foundation of mindfulness that is natural.

original: de dag gi dmigs pa ni zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de dag gi dmigs pa ni zhes bya ba la /
translated: Their focal object is

analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rjes su lta ba nyid dran pa nye bar gzhag pa yin pas /

original: rjes su lta ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su lta ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'o //

analyzed: des de dang ldan pa rjes su lta bar byed do zhes bya ba ni shes rab dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

analyzed: 'dis rjes su lta bar byed pa na rjes su lta ba zhes bya ba'o //

original: 'di la rjes su lta ba ste /
analyzed: 'di la rjes su lta ba ste /

original: lta ba shes rab yod pas na rjes su lta ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: lta ba shes rab yod pas na rjes su lta ba la sogs pa ste /

original: 'di ni mdo las 'don pa gzhan bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mdo las 'don pa gzhan bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the teaching of another version of the s≈´tra.
