analyzed: de'i de lta na dran pa nye bar gnas pas shes rab dran pa nye bar gzhag pa yin no //
translated: Thus, because memory is present, wisdom is the application of mindfulness.

original: 'di ltar na rung ste zhes bya ba ni byed par bsgrub pa'i dbang du byas pa ste de nyid kyi phyir 'dis dran pa nye bar 'jog pas na zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: 'di ltar na rung ste zhes bya ba ni byed par bsgrub pa'i dbang du byas pa ste de nyid kyi phyir 'dis dran pa nye bar 'jog pas na zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: This is possible, from the perspective of the establishment of the agent. Therefore, it is said: because it causes the application of mindfulness.

original: ji ltar shes rab kyis dran pa nye bar 'jog ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar shes rab kyis dran pa nye bar 'jog ce na /
translated: How does wisdom cause the application of mindfulness?

original: de'i phyir ji ltar mthong ba mngon par brjod pa'i phyir ro zhes @161b bya ba smos te bsam pa ni dran pa nyid shes rab kyi stobs bskyed pas 'jug pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar mthong ba mngon par brjod pa'i phyir ro zhes @161b bya ba smos te bsam pa ni dran pa nyid shes rab kyi stobs bskyed pas 'jug pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚Äúbecause it expresses what is seen,‚Äù and the idea is that memory is engaged through the power of wisdom.

original: mngon par brjod pa ni de ltar dran pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par brjod pa ni de ltar dran pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúExpression‚Äù is memory in that way.

original: yang gang du nye bar gnas she na /
analyzed: yang gang du nye bar gnas she na /
translated: Moreover, where is it situated?

original: lus nas chos kyi bar dag la'o //
analyzed: lus nas chos kyi bar dag la'o //
translated: In the body, etc., up to dharmas.

original: de nyid kyi phyir tshig rnam par sbyar ba ni lus la dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir tshig rnam par sbyar ba ni lus la dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the analysis of the compound is that mindfulness of the body is the application of mindfulness to the body, etc.

original: byed pa byed pa por byas nas dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i don mdo'i nang nas 'byung ba bshad zin to //
analyzed: byed pa byed pa por byas nas dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i don mdo'i nang nas 'byung ba bshad zin to //
translated: The meaning of the application of mindfulness as it occurs in the sutras has been explained by making the agent into the object.üîΩFrom what?

original: gang las zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni zas kun 'byung bas ni lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa kun 'byung ba yin la /
analyzed: gang las zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni zas kun 'byung bas ni lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa kun 'byung ba yin la /
translated: The arising of the body is from the arising of nutriment.

original: zas 'gags pas ni lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa nub pa yin no //
analyzed: zas 'gags pas ni lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa nub pa yin no //
translated: The cessation of food is the disappearance of the establishment of mindfulness of the body.

original: reg pa kun 'byung bas ni tshor ba kun 'byung ba yin la /
analyzed: reg pa kun 'byung bas ni tshor ba kun 'byung ba yin la /
translated: The origin of contact is the origin of the establishment of mindfulness of feeling.

original: reg pa 'gags pas ni tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa nub pa yin no //
analyzed: reg pa 'gags pas ni tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa nub pa yin no //
translated: The cessation of contact is the disappearance of the establishment of mindfulness of feeling.

original: ming dang gzugs kun 'byung bas ni sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pa kun 'byung ba yin la zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs kun 'byung bas ni sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pa kun 'byung ba yin la zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The origin of name-and-form is the origin of the establishment of mindfulness of mind.

original: yid la byed pa kun 'byung bas ni chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa kun 'byung ba yin la zhes bya ba yang snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: yid la byed pa kun 'byung bas ni chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa kun 'byung ba yin la zhes bya ba yang snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The origin of attention is the origin of the establishment of mindfulness of dharmas.

original: yang ji ltar 'di dmigs pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar 'di dmigs pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa yin zhe na /
translated: How are these the establishment of mindfulness with regard to objects?

original: 'di la dran pa nye bar gnas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'di la dran pa nye bar gnas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, because mindfulness is well-established in them.

original: 'di la nye bar gnas pas na nye bar gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: 'di la nye bar gnas pas na nye bar gzhag pa'o //
translated: They are established in this, thus they are the establishment of mindfulness.

original: gal te mdo de las dmigs pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa yin par bzhed par ma gyur na ni /
analyzed: gal te mdo de las dmigs pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa yin par bzhed par ma gyur na ni /
translated: If the S≈´tra did not intend the establishment of mindfulness with regard to objects,üîΩthen what would be the point of saying, ‚Äúbecause mindfulness is well-established in them‚Äù?

original: dge slong dag ji ltar na dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi zhes bya ba nas rgyas par zas kun 'byung bas ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ci'i phyir gsung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: dge slong dag ji ltar na dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi zhes bya ba nas rgyas par zas kun 'byung bas ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ci'i phyir gsung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Why would the Buddha say, ‚ÄúMonks, how are there four establishments of mindfulness?‚Äù up to ‚ÄúThe origin of food is the origin of the four establishments of mindfulness,‚Äù and so on?

original: lus la sogs pa ni shes rab kyi rang bzhin ma yin la /
analyzed: lus la sogs pa ni shes rab kyi rang bzhin ma yin la /
translated: The body and so on are not the nature of wisdom.

original: 'du shes la sogs pa'i rang bzhin yang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'du shes la sogs pa'i rang bzhin yang ma yin no //
translated: They are also not the nature of discernment and so on.

original: 'di dag gi ming ni dmigs pa ji lta ba bzhin yin no zhes bya ba ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa de dag gi dmigs pa ni lus la sogs pa yin te //
analyzed: 'di dag gi ming ni dmigs pa ji lta ba bzhin yin no zhes bya ba ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa de dag gi dmigs pa ni lus la sogs pa yin te //
translated: Their names correspond to their focal objects. The focal objects of those establishments of mindfulness are the body and so on.

original: de'i phyir lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa zhes bya'o //üîΩ'di dag rang dang gzhan gnyi ga'i rgyud la dmigs pa'i phyir re re zhing rnam pa gsum gsum yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa zhes bya'o // 'di dag rang dang gzhan gnyi ga'i rgyud la dmigs pa'i phyir re re zhing rnam pa gsum gsum yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Therefore they are called the establishment of mindfulness of the body and so on.üîΩEach of them has three aspects because they focus on the mindstreams of oneself, others, and both.

original: rang gi rgyud la dmigs pa'i phyir dang gzhan gyi rgyud la dmigs pa'i phyir dang / gnyi ga'i rgyud la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi rgyud la dmigs pa'i phyir dang gzhan gyi rgyud la dmigs pa'i phyir dang / gnyi ga'i rgyud la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They focus on one‚Äôs own mindstream, they focus on the mindstreams of others, and they focus on the mindstreams of both.

original: ji skad du zhe na /
analyzed: ji skad du zhe na /
translated: What is said?

original: brtun pa dang shes bzhin dang dran pa dang ldan par gyur nas 'jig rten la brnab sems dang yid mi bde ba rnams spangs te nang gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas so zhes bya ba @162a * //
analyzed: brtun pa dang shes bzhin dang dran pa dang ldan par gyur nas 'jig rten la brnab sems dang yid mi bde ba rnams spangs te nang gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas so zhes bya ba @162a * //
translated: Having become endowed with effort, awareness, and mindfulness, having abandoned worldly covetousness and depression, he dwells while observing the internal body.

original: dang ; de bzhin du phyi'i lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas so zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: dang ; de bzhin du phyi'i lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas so zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: And likewise, he dwells while observing the external body.

original: nang dang phyi'i lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas so zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin te /
analyzed: nang dang phyi'i lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas so zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin te /
translated: He dwells while observing the internal and external body.

original: de ltar na tshul 'dis rnam pa gsum yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na tshul 'dis rnam pa gsum yin no //
translated: Thus, by this method, there are three.

original: tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa rnams la yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa rnams la yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The applications of mindfulness of feeling, mind, and dharmas should be applied in the same way.

original: sngar rags pa mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la lus ni 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa yin pa'i phyir rags pas de sngar mthong ngo //
analyzed: sngar rags pa mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la lus ni 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa yin pa'i phyir rags pas de sngar mthong ngo //
translated: Because the body is seen first, since it is gross. The body is gross because it is composed of the elements and the derivatives of the elements. Therefore, it is seen first.

original: de nas tshor ba ste rgyu ba rags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nas tshor ba ste rgyu ba rags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Then feeling, because it is the grossest of the three, since it is the movement of the mind.

original: de'i mjug thogs su ni sems yin te /
analyzed: de'i mjug thogs su ni sems yin te /
translated: Immediately after that, the mind,

original: chos rnams pas so so rnam par rig pa'i rnam par mtshon sla ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos rnams pas so so rnam par rig pa'i rnam par mtshon sla ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is easier to characterize the mind than the other two, since it is the individual cognition of the dharmas.

original: chos ni 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang mi ldan pa la sogs pa'i dbye bas shin tu phra ba yin no //
analyzed: chos ni 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang mi ldan pa la sogs pa'i dbye bas shin tu phra ba yin no //
translated: The dharmas are the most subtle, because of the distinctions of the conditioned and unconditioned, the associated and nonassociated, and so on.

original: yang na 'di ltar 'dod pa la 'dod chags pa'i rten ni lus yin la zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa lus yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: yang na 'di ltar 'dod pa la 'dod chags pa'i rten ni lus yin la zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa lus yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: Or, in this way, the body is the basis of desire for the desirable, that is, the object of desire is the body.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: dge slong dag bud med kyi gzugs la chags shing 'dod chags la bcings zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa lta bu'o //üîΩde yang zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa la 'dod chags pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong dag bud med kyi gzugs la chags shing 'dod chags la bcings zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa lta bu'o // de yang zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa la 'dod chags pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúMonks, a man is attached to the form of a woman and is bound by desire.‚ÄùüîΩAnd that, the desire for the desirable,

original: de yang sems zhes bya ba ni tshor ba mngon par 'dod pa de'o //
analyzed: de yang sems zhes bya ba ni tshor ba mngon par 'dod pa de'o //
translated: is the mind, the desire for feeling.

original: sems ma zhi ba ni nyon mongs pa ma spangs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: sems ma zhi ba ni nyon mongs pa ma spangs pa'i phyir te /
translated: The mind is not peaceful because the afflictions have not been abandoned.

original: nyon mongs pa rnams chos kyi skye mched kyi khongs su 'du ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams chos kyi skye mched kyi khongs su 'du ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The afflictions are included in the phenomena base.

original: go rims bzhin du zhes bya ba ni lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni gtsang bar phyin ci log pa'i gnyen por bstan te /
analyzed: go rims bzhin du zhes bya ba ni lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni gtsang bar phyin ci log pa'i gnyen por bstan te /
translated: The four establishments of mindfulness are taught as the antidotes to the four errors, respectively.

original: lus ni phyis dang 'dra bar mi gtsang ba'i bdag nyid yin no //
analyzed: lus ni phyis dang 'dra bar mi gtsang ba'i bdag nyid yin no //
translated: The body is like a sack of excrement, since it is by nature impure.

original: chos lhag ma rnams ni de 'brel pas mi gtsang ba yin te /
analyzed: chos lhag ma rnams ni de 'brel pas mi gtsang ba yin te /
translated: The remaining phenomena are impure because they are related to the body,

original: phyi sa dang 'byar ba'i phyag dar bzhin no //
analyzed: phyi sa dang 'byar ba'i phyag dar bzhin no //
translated: like a broom is related to excrement.

original: tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni bde bar phyin ci log pa'i gnyen por te /
analyzed: tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni bde bar phyin ci log pa'i gnyen por te /
translated: The establishment of mindfulness of feeling is the antidote to the error of pleasure,

original: gang ci tshor yang rung de ni 'dir sdug bsngal lo zhes 'byung bas so //
analyzed: gang ci tshor yang rung de ni 'dir sdug bsngal lo zhes 'byung bas so //
translated: because it is said, ‚ÄúWhatever is felt is felt in this life as suffering.‚Äù

original: sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni rtag par phyin ci log pa'i gnyen por te /
analyzed: sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni rtag par phyin ci log pa'i gnyen por te /
translated: The establishment of mindfulness of mind is the antidote to the error of permanence,

original: sems ni myur du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems ni myur du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the mind quickly changes.

original: chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni bdag tu phyin ci log pa'i gnyen por bstan to //
analyzed: chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni bdag tu phyin ci log pa'i gnyen por bstan to //
translated: The application of mindfulness to the dharmas is taught as the antidote to the error of self.

original: chos rnams ril por rnam par dbye ba'i sgo nas 'di ni chos tsam du zad kyi /
analyzed: chos rnams ril por rnam par dbye ba'i sgo nas 'di ni chos tsam du zad kyi /
translated: The dharmas are all divided up, and it is said, ‚ÄúThis is just the dharmas.

original: 'di ni bdag ma yin no zhes bdag tu 'du shes pa phyin ci log gi gnyen po yin no //üîΩgsum ni ma 'dres pa la dmigs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni lus la dmigs pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni lus kho na la dmigs @162b pa nas /
analyzed: 'di ni bdag ma yin no zhes bdag tu 'du shes pa phyin ci log gi gnyen po yin no // gsum ni ma 'dres pa la dmigs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni lus la dmigs pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni lus kho na la dmigs @162b pa nas /
translated: This is not the self.‚Äù It is the antidote to the error of the perception of self.

original: sems la dmigs pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni sems kho na la dmigs pa'i bar yin te /
analyzed: sems la dmigs pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni sems kho na la dmigs pa'i bar yin te /
translated: Three are focused on the unmixed, that is, the application of mindfulness focused on the body is focused on just the body, and so on up to the application of mindfulness focused on the mind is focused on just the mind.

original: so sor nges pa la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: so sor nges pa la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are focused on the individual.

original: bzhi pa ni gnyi ga yin te zhes bya ba ni chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ste 'dres pa la dmigs pa ni spyi la dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: bzhi pa ni gnyi ga yin te zhes bya ba ni chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ste 'dres pa la dmigs pa ni spyi la dmigs pa ste /
translated: The fourth is both, that is, the application of mindfulness to the dharmas. The mixed is focused on the general.

original: 'dres ma la dmigs zhes bya ba'i don to ;
analyzed: 'dres ma la dmigs zhes bya ba'i don to ;
translated: The meaning of focused on the mixed is the meaning of focused on the general.

original: / ma 'dres pa la dmigs pa ni 'dres pa ma yin pa la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: / ma 'dres pa la dmigs pa ni 'dres pa ma yin pa la dmigs pa'o //
translated: The object of the unmixed is the unmixed object.

original: spyi la dmigs pa la gnas te zhes bya ba ni lus la sogs pa thams cad spyir bsdus te /
analyzed: spyi la dmigs pa la gnas te zhes bya ba ni lus la sogs pa thams cad spyir bsdus te /
translated: Abiding in the object of the general, means that all bodies, etc. are included in the general.

original: mi rtag pa la dmigs pa'i rnam par lta ba'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pa la dmigs pa'i rnam par lta ba'o //
translated: The view of the object of impermanence is the view of the object of the general.

original: de las dro bar gyur pa 'byung //
analyzed: de las dro bar gyur pa 'byung //
translated: From that, the state of heat arises.

original: zhes bya ba la chos rjes su dran pa'i mjug thogs su 'du byed skad cig mar khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir skye ba dang 'jig pa la dpyod do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la chos rjes su dran pa'i mjug thogs su 'du byed skad cig mar khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir skye ba dang 'jig pa la dpyod do //
translated: After the recollection of the Dharma, in order to understand the momentary nature of formations, one examines arising and perishing.

original: 'du byed rnams skad cig ma yin na ji ltar 'du byed rjes su 'jug / de nas rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la dpyod do //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams skad cig ma yin na ji ltar 'du byed rjes su 'jug / de nas rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la dpyod do //
translated: If formations are momentary, how do they continue? Then one examines dependent origination.

original: gang gi tshe zag pa dang bcas pa'i shes rab kyis rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba khong du chud pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe zag pa dang bcas pa'i shes rab kyis rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba khong du chud pa de'i tshe /
translated: When one understands dependent origination with contaminated wisdom,

original: de'i mjug thogs su chos thams cad la dmigs pa'i sgo nas bdag med pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: de'i mjug thogs su chos thams cad la dmigs pa'i sgo nas bdag med pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: then immediately after that, one has the aspect of selflessness by means of observing all dharmas.

original: de'i mjug thogs su phung po dang khams dang skyed mched de /
analyzed: de'i mjug thogs su phung po dang khams dang skyed mched de /
translated: Immediately after that, one should analyze and abide in the three topics of the aggregates, elements, and sense bases.

original: don rnam pa gsum la dpyod cing gnas bdun la mkhas pa ste /
analyzed: don rnam pa gsum la dpyod cing gnas bdun la mkhas pa ste /
translated: Thus, one should be skilled in the seven topics.

original: de ltar na chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa spyi la dmigs pa las dro bar gyur pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba 'byung ngo zhes bya ba 'di ni go rims so //
analyzed: de ltar na chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa spyi la dmigs pa las dro bar gyur pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba 'byung ngo zhes bya ba 'di ni go rims so //
translated: This is the order: the root of merit that is the heat of Dharma that arises from the object of meditation that is the general object of mindfulness of Dharma.

original: slob dpon gyis ni cung zad dper brjod pa tsam zhig bshad do //
analyzed: slob dpon gyis ni cung zad dper brjod pa tsam zhig bshad do //
translated: The master has explained just a brief example.

original: dro bar gyur pa zhes bya ba ni dro ba'i rnam pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'o //
analyzed: dro bar gyur pa zhes bya ba ni dro ba'i rnam pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'o //
translated: The root of merit that is heat is the root of merit that has the aspect of heat.

original: dro bar gyur pa dang 'dra bas na dro bar gyur ba ste /
analyzed: dro bar gyur pa dang 'dra bas na dro bar gyur ba ste /
translated: It is called heat because it is similar to heat.üîΩIt is the sign of the fire of the noble path.

original: 'phags pa'i lam gyi me'i snga ltas yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni ji ltar gtsub shing steng 'og gtsubs pa las me'i snga ltas 'byung ba de bzhin du shes pa dang shes bya'i gtsub shing gtsubs pa las 'phags pa'i lam gyi me'i drod 'byung la drod
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam gyi me'i snga ltas yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni ji ltar gtsub shing steng 'og gtsubs pa las me'i snga ltas 'byung ba de bzhin du shes pa dang shes bya'i gtsub shing gtsubs pa las 'phags pa'i lam gyi me'i drod 'byung la drod
translated: Just as the sign of fire arises from the rubbing of the upper and lower sticks for kindling, in the same way, the heat of the fire of the noble path arises from the rubbing of the sticks of consciousness and objects of consciousness.

original: la ni brtson 'grus kyis yang dang yang du mngon par gtsubs pa'i rim gyis srid pa'i bud shing skam po sreg pa las 'jibs pa zag pa med pa'i ye shes kyi me 'byung ste /
analyzed: la ni brtson 'grus kyis yang dang yang du mngon par gtsubs pa'i rim gyis srid pa'i bud shing skam po sreg pa las 'jibs pa zag pa med pa'i ye shes kyi me 'byung ste /
translated: The fire of uncontaminated transcendent wisdom arises from the gradual burning of the dry firewood of existence through the process of repeatedly igniting it with the fire sticks of effort.

original: de'i phyir dro bar 'gyur ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir dro bar 'gyur ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore it is called the root of virtue that is heat.

original: rgyun chags pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba rgyun 'brel pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rgyun chags pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba rgyun 'brel pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is called heat because it is a sign of the fire of transcendent wisdom that is about to arise, like the heat of fire that is about to arise.

original: de lta ma yin te dmigs pa rnam par chad pa'i dbang du byas te skad cig ma nyid yin na ni bden pa bzhi la dmigs par yang mi 'gyur na @163a * //
analyzed: de lta ma yin te dmigs pa rnam par chad pa'i dbang du byas te skad cig ma nyid yin na ni bden pa bzhi la dmigs par yang mi 'gyur na @163a * //
translated: If it were not so, if it were momentary in terms of the interruption of its object, it would not focus on the four truths,üîΩlet alone sixteen aspects.

original: rnam pa gzhan brjod par 'dod pas de la bden pa gsum la dmigs pa'i dro bar gyur pa rnam pa gtod pa la ni zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan brjod par 'dod pas de la bden pa gsum la dmigs pa'i dro bar gyur pa rnam pa gtod pa la ni zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The aspects of the truth of cessation are explained later.üîΩThe Abhidharmakosa states,üîΩThe aspects of the three truths are directed to the aspects of heat.

original: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba dang lam la dmigs pa'i rnam pa la'o//
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba dang lam la dmigs pa'i rnam pa la'o//
translated: The aspects of heat are directed to the aspects of the three truths.

original: @164b 'gog pa dmigs pa ni 'og nas 'chad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @164b 'gog pa dmigs pa ni 'og nas 'chad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The aspects of the truth of cessation are explained later.

original: chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa da ltar byung ba yin la zhes bya ba 'byung ste sdug bsngal la sogs pa rnams phung po lnga'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir de dag la dmigs pa'i chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa da ltar byung ba yin no //üîΩma 'ongs pa ni bzhi char thob bo zhes bya ba ni lus dang tshor ba dang sems dang chos dran pa nye bar gzhag go //
analyzed: chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa da ltar byung ba yin la zhes bya ba 'byung ste sdug bsngal la sogs pa rnams phung po lnga'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir de dag la dmigs pa'i chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa da ltar byung ba yin no // ma 'ongs pa ni bzhi char thob bo zhes bya ba ni lus dang tshor ba dang sems dang chos dran pa nye bar gzhag go //
translated: Because suffering and so on are the nature of the five aggregates, the present close placement of mindfulness of phenomena that focuses on them is present.üîΩThe future is obtained in four.

original: lus dang tshor ba la sogs pa rnams sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i khongs su 'du ba'i phyir de dag la dmigs pa ma 'ongs pa bzhi char 'thob ste /
analyzed: lus dang tshor ba la sogs pa rnams sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i khongs su 'du ba'i phyir de dag la dmigs pa ma 'ongs pa bzhi char 'thob ste /
translated: The future close placement of mindfulness of body, feeling, mind and phenomena is obtained because body, feeling and so on are subsumed within suffering and so on.

original: cher sbyangs pa rnams kyi thob pa skye zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: cher sbyangs pa rnams kyi thob pa skye zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Those who are greatly trained obtain it.

original: da ltar byung ba ni thob pa dang bcas te rten pas thob pa'i sgo nas mngon du gyur pa nyid du thob po //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba ni thob pa dang bcas te rten pas thob pa'i sgo nas mngon du gyur pa nyid du thob po //
translated: The present is obtained through obtaining it and through obtaining it through manifesting it by means of support.

original: de kho na gnyi ga yin no zhes bya ba ni chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa da ltar ba dang ma 'ongs pa de kho na thob bo //
analyzed: de kho na gnyi ga yin no zhes bya ba ni chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa da ltar ba dang ma 'ongs pa de kho na thob bo //
translated: That is the present and future applications of mindfulness to dharmas.

original: de la ni tshor ba la sogs pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la ni tshor ba la sogs pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: There is no feeling, etc. there,

original: 'gog pa phung po lnga'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gog pa phung po lnga'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because cessation is not of the nature of the five aggregates.üîΩAll the aspects are similar.

original: rnam pa dag ni thams cad du 'dra ba yin no zhes bya ba ni bden pa gsum la dmigs pa dang / 'gog pa la dmigs pa'i dro bar gyur pa'i rnam pa gtod pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa dag ni thams cad du 'dra ba yin no zhes bya ba ni bden pa gsum la dmigs pa dang / 'gog pa la dmigs pa'i dro bar gyur pa'i rnam pa gtod pa ste /
translated: The aspects of the heat that focuses on the three truths and the heat that focuses on cessation are the same.

original: 'dra ba ni mtshungs pa yin zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: 'dra ba ni mtshungs pa yin zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: Similar means the same.

original: bden pa gang dang gang la rnam pa gang dang gang mngon du byed pa de dang rigs mthun pa ma 'ongs pa kho na des 'thob kyi /
analyzed: bden pa gang dang gang la rnam pa gang dang gang mngon du byed pa de dang rigs mthun pa ma 'ongs pa kho na des 'thob kyi /
translated: One obtains only those future aspects that are of the same type as those that manifest in relation to any truth.

original: gzhan ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan ni ma yin te /
translated: One does not obtain other aspects.

original: rigs rnams ma thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs rnams ma thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one has not obtained their types.

original: rnam par 'phel ba la ni zhes bya ba ni byang bar bya ba la'o //
analyzed: rnam par 'phel ba la ni zhes bya ba ni byang bar bya ba la'o //
translated: In the increase means in the process of perfecting.

original: bzhi las gang yang rung ba zhig ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: bzhi las gang yang rung ba zhig ces bya ba ni /
translated: Any one of the four foundations of mindfulness is present,

original: lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa rnams las gang yang rung ba zhig da ltar byung ba yin te /
analyzed: lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa rnams las gang yang rung ba zhig da ltar byung ba yin te /
translated: because the foundations of mindfulness of body, etc. are any one of the four present.

original: gang zhig gang la dmigs pa de ni dmigs par bya ba'i sgo nas da ltar byung ba yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig gang la dmigs pa de ni dmigs par bya ba'i sgo nas da ltar byung ba yin no //
translated: That which is present is present in terms of the object of observation.

original: ma 'ongs pa ni bzhi char rnyed pa thob pa nyid kyi sgo nas 'thob bo //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa ni bzhi char rnyed pa thob pa nyid kyi sgo nas 'thob bo //
translated: The future is obtained in terms of obtaining the obtainment of the four.

original: 'gog pa la dmigs pa dro bar gyur pa 'phel ba de kho na nyid la ni tha ma chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa da ltar byung ba yin te /
analyzed: 'gog pa la dmigs pa dro bar gyur pa 'phel ba de kho na nyid la ni tha ma chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa da ltar byung ba yin te /
translated: When heat that focuses on cessation increases, the final foundation of mindfulness of phenomena is present.

original: de la lus la sogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la lus la sogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because body, etc. do not exist there.

original: ma 'ongs pa ni bzhi char thob ste /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa ni bzhi char thob ste /
translated: The future is obtained in terms of the four.

original: 'dis sngar 'thob pa gang dag yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'dis sngar 'thob pa gang dag yin pa'o //
translated: This is because those that are obtained previously are obtained.üîΩThe aspects are all,

original: rnam pa ni thams cad de zhes bya ba ni bcu drug go //
analyzed: rnam pa ni thams cad de zhes bya ba ni bcu drug go //
translated: because there are sixteen.

original: rigs rnams thob zin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rigs rnams thob zin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because the lineages have already been obtained.

original: sngar rnam pa gtod pa'i gnas skabs kyi rim pas rigs rnams thob zin pa yin te /
analyzed: sngar rnam pa gtod pa'i gnas skabs kyi rim pas rigs rnams thob zin pa yin te /
translated: Previously, the lineages were obtained through the stages of directing the aspects.

original: 'dir rnam pa rnams kyis ni skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu la mngon par 'dod la /üîΩde dag @165a * //
analyzed: 'dir rnam pa rnams kyis ni skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu la mngon par 'dod la / de dag @165a * //
translated: Here, the homogeneous cause is asserted to be the aspects.

original: kyang rnam pa gtod pa'i dus kho nar thob zin to //
analyzed: kyang rnam pa gtod pa'i dus kho nar thob zin to //
translated: They are obtained at the time of directing the aspects.

original: rtse mo bden pa bzhi la dmigs pa rnam par gtod pa la ni chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa da ltar byung ba yin la /
analyzed: rtse mo bden pa bzhi la dmigs pa rnam par gtod pa la ni chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa da ltar byung ba yin la /
translated: When the peak focuses on the four truths, the present foundation of mindfulness of dharmas is generated.

original: ma 'ongs pa ni bzhi char 'thob bo //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa ni bzhi char 'thob bo //
translated: In the future, all four are obtained.

original: 'gog pa la dmigs pa 'phel ba la ni tha ma chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa da ltar byung ba yin la /
analyzed: 'gog pa la dmigs pa 'phel ba la ni tha ma chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa da ltar byung ba yin la /
translated: When the increase of the peak focuses on cessation, the present foundation of mindfulness of dharmas is generated.

original: ma 'ongs pa la ni bzhi char 'thob ste /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa la ni bzhi char 'thob ste /
translated: In the future, all four are obtained.

original: de dag 'thob pa skyes zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag 'thob pa skyes zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are obtained when they arise.

original: rnam pa ni thams cad do zhes bya ba ni dro bar gyur pa'i rnam pa gtod pa'i tshe de'i rigs rnams thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa ni thams cad do zhes bya ba ni dro bar gyur pa'i rnam pa gtod pa'i tshe de'i rigs rnams thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: All aspects means that when the aspects of heat are directed, the lineages of heat are obtained.

original: bden pa gsum la dmigs pa rnam par 'phel ba la ni /
analyzed: bden pa gsum la dmigs pa rnam par 'phel ba la ni /
translated: When focusing on three truths,üîΩthe last is present.

original: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba dang lam la dmigs pa la ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba dang lam la dmigs pa la ste /
translated: When focusing on the truths of suffering, origin, and path,

original: bzhi las gang yang rung ba zhig da ltar byung ba yin la /
analyzed: bzhi las gang yang rung ba zhig da ltar byung ba yin la /
translated: any one of the four foundations of mindfulness is present.

original: ma 'ongs pa ni bzhi char ro //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa ni bzhi char ro //
translated: In the future, all four are cultivated.

original: rigs thob zin pa'i phyir rnam pa yang thams cad do //
analyzed: rigs thob zin pa'i phyir rnam pa yang thams cad do //
translated: Since the lineage has already been obtained, all aspects are cultivated.üîΩIn the case of the acceptances, the last is present in all cases.

original: bzod pa rnams la ni thams cad du tha ma yin la zhes bya ba ni bzod pa rnams la ni rnam pa gtod pa dang rnam par 'phel ba la yang tha ma chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa kho na da ltar byung ba yin te /
analyzed: bzod pa rnams la ni thams cad du tha ma yin la zhes bya ba ni bzod pa rnams la ni rnam pa gtod pa dang rnam par 'phel ba la yang tha ma chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa kho na da ltar byung ba yin te /
translated: In the case of the acceptances, the last foundation of mindfulness, that of mindfulness of phenomena, is present in both the setting of the aspects and the increase of the aspects.

original: 'di ltar bzod pa ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar bzod pa ni /
translated: As it is said,

original: thams cad chos kyis 'phel bar byed //üîΩces bya bas so //
analyzed: thams cad chos kyis 'phel bar byed // ces bya bas so //
translated: The acceptances are increased by all phenomena.

original: chos kyi mchog dag la ni tha ma yin la zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chos kyi mchog dag la ni tha ma yin la zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In the case of the supreme mundane state, the last is present.

original: chos kyi mchog mngon du byed pa la ni tha ma chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa da ltar byung ba yin no //
analyzed: chos kyi mchog mngon du byed pa la ni tha ma chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa da ltar byung ba yin no //
translated: In the case of manifesting the supreme mundane state, the last foundation of mindfulness, that of mindfulness of phenomena, is present.

original: ma 'ongs pa ni bzhi char ro //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa ni bzhi char ro //
translated: The future is all four.

original: rnam pa ni bzhi kho na ste zhes bya ba 'di ni mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba dang stong pa dang bdag med pa'i rnam pa dag go //
analyzed: rnam pa ni bzhi kho na ste zhes bya ba 'di ni mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba dang stong pa dang bdag med pa'i rnam pa dag go //
translated: The aspects are only four: impermanence, suffering, empty, and self-less.

original: gzhan med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar chos kyi mchog la kun 'byung ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa gzhan ni med de /
analyzed: gzhan med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar chos kyi mchog la kun 'byung ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa gzhan ni med de /
translated: Because the others do not exist, that is, because the aspects of origination, etc., do not exist in the supreme mundane state,

original: sdug bsngal tsam la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal tsam la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it focuses on mere suffering.üîΩBecause it is similar to the path of seeing.

original: mthong ba'i lam dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la 'dra ba ni mthong ba'i lam dang nye ba nyid dang / de dang sa gcig pa nyid do //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la 'dra ba ni mthong ba'i lam dang nye ba nyid dang / de dang sa gcig pa nyid do //
translated: Similarity means that it is proximate to the path of seeing and it is of the same level as the path of seeing.

original: mthong ba'i lam la ni bden pa gang zhig mthong bar 'gyur ba de'i rnam pa dag kho na 'thob la /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam la ni bden pa gang zhig mthong bar 'gyur ba de'i rnam pa dag kho na 'thob la /
translated: On the path of seeing, one obtains only the aspects of the truth that is being seen.

original: mthong ba'i lam dang por 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal la dmigs pa yin te /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam dang por 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal la dmigs pa yin te /
translated: The path of seeing is first generated in the desire realm and focuses on suffering.

original: ji ltar der bzhi kho na thob pa de bzhin du chos mchog dag tu yang yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar der bzhi kho na thob pa de bzhin du chos mchog dag tu yang yin no //
translated: Just as one obtains only four aspects on the path of seeing, so too in the supreme mundane state.

original: 'byed pa ni rnam par 'byed pa ste /
analyzed: 'byed pa ni rnam par 'byed pa ste /
translated: Analysis is thorough analysis.üîΩIt is called the path of preparation because it is the basis for the prior certainty and because it is the basis for the certainty that is the path of seeing.

original: nges pa sngon du 'gro ba de la gnas pa dang / nges par 'byed pas na nges par 'byed pa 'am /
analyzed: nges pa sngon du 'gro ba de la gnas pa dang / nges par 'byed pas na nges par 'byed pa 'am /
translated: Or, it is called the path of preparation because it is the basis for the path of seeing.üîΩWhat is that?üîΩIt is the noble path, which is to say, right view and the rest.

original: yang na gang gis nges par 'byed pa de ni nges par 'byed pa yin no //üîΩde yang gang zhig ce na /
analyzed: yang na gang gis nges par 'byed pa de ni nges par 'byed pa yin no // de yang gang zhig ce na /
translated: This is the path of preparation because it abandons doubt.üîΩThis shows that it is only the noble path that is the path of preparation, not anything else.üîΩWhy is it the path of preparation?

original: 'phags pa'i lam ma zhes bya @165b ba smos te /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam ma zhes bya @165b ba smos te /
translated: What is that?

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: It is the noble path, which is to say, right view and the rest.üîΩThis is the path of preparation because it abandons doubt.üîΩThis shows that it is only the noble path that is the path of preparation, not anything else.

original: des the tshom spong ba'i phyir dang zhes bya ba 'dis ni de nyid kho na nges par 'byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: des the tshom spong ba'i phyir dang zhes bya ba 'dis ni de nyid kho na nges par 'byed pa yin gyi /
translated: Why is it the path of preparation?üîΩWhat is that?üîΩIt is the noble path, which is to say, right view and the rest.üîΩThis is the path of preparation because it abandons doubt.

original: gzhan ma yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: gzhan ma yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: This shows that it is only the noble path that is the path of preparation, not anything else.üîΩWhy is it the path of preparation?üîΩWhat is that?üîΩIt is the noble path, which is to say, right view and the rest.

original: rnam par 'byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la ci zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par 'byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la ci zhe na /
translated: This is the path of preparation because it abandons doubt.üîΩThis shows that it is only the noble path that is the path of preparation, not anything else.üîΩWhy is it the path of preparation?üîΩWhat is that?üîΩIt is the noble path, which is to say, right view and the rest.

original: 'di ni nges par 'byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni nges par 'byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is the path of preparation because it abandons doubt.üîΩThis shows that it is only the noble path that is the path of preparation, not anything else.üîΩWhy is it the path of preparation?üîΩWhat is that?üîΩIt is the noble path, which is to say, right view and the rest.

original: ji ltar rnam par 'byed pa'i phyir yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar rnam par 'byed pa'i phyir yin zhe na /
translated: This is the path of preparation because it abandons doubt.

original: de'i phyir 'di ni sdug bsngal lo zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ni sdug bsngal lo zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
translated: This shows that it is only the noble path that is the path of preparation, not anything else.üîΩWhy is it the path of preparation?üîΩWhat is that?üîΩIt is the noble path, which is to say, right view and the rest.üîΩThis is the path of preparation because it abandons doubt.üîΩThis shows that it is only the noble path that is the path of preparation, not anything else.

original: de 'dren par byed pa nyid kyis phan 'dogs par byed pa'i phyir nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams so zhes bya ba la gsum ni brgyud pa'i sgo nas de 'dren par byed pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: de 'dren par byed pa nyid kyis phan 'dogs par byed pa'i phyir nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams so zhes bya ba la gsum ni brgyud pa'i sgo nas de 'dren par byed pa nyid yin la /
translated: The three are conducive to penetrations indirectly,

original: chos kyi mchog rnams ni dngos su'o //
analyzed: chos kyi mchog rnams ni dngos su'o //
translated: but the supreme mundane state is conducive to penetrations directly.

original: bsgom byung zhes bya ba ni de dag mnyam par gzhag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩmi lcogs pa med pa dang khyad par bsam gtan sa pa'o zhes bya ba la mi lcogs pa med pa dang / khyad par can dang bsam gtan dag gi sa pa yin pas na /
analyzed: bsgom byung zhes bya ba ni de dag mnyam par gzhag pa yin pa'i phyir ro // mi lcogs pa med pa dang khyad par bsam gtan sa pa'o zhes bya ba la mi lcogs pa med pa dang / khyad par can dang bsam gtan dag gi sa pa yin pas na /
translated: They are called ‚Äúarisen from meditation‚Äù because they are equipoise.üîΩThey are the level of unrestricted access concentration, special absorption, and the absorptions.

original: mi lcogs pa med pa dang / khyad par bsam gtan sa pa'o //
analyzed: mi lcogs pa med pa dang / khyad par bsam gtan sa pa'o //
translated: They are the level of unrestricted access concentration, special absorption, and the absorptions because they are the levels of unrestricted access concentration, special absorption, and the absorptions.

original: de dag gis bsdus pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de dag dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de dag gis bsdus pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de dag dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: They are called ‚Äústages conducive to penetrations‚Äù because they are included in those.

original: mthong ba'i lam gyi 'khor yin pa'i phyir gong na ni med do zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam ni sa drug pa yin la /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam gyi 'khor yin pa'i phyir gong na ni med do zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam ni sa drug pa yin la /
translated: The path of seeing is the sixth stage.

original: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa dag kyang mthong ba'i lam gyi 'khor du gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa dag kyang mthong ba'i lam gyi 'khor du gyur pa yin te /
translated: The factors conducive to penetrative insight are also the retinue of the path of seeing.

original: de'i phyir gong na ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir gong na ste /
translated: Therefore, it is not higher.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams na med do //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams na med do //
translated: It does not exist in the formless realm.

original: de med pa zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam med pa'o //
analyzed: de med pa zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam med pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúit does not exist‚Äù means that the path of seeing does not exist there.

original: yang ci'i phyir gong na mthong ba'i lam med ce na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir gong na mthong ba'i lam med ce na /
translated: Why does the path of seeing not exist there?

original: de'i phyir de med pa ni 'dod pa'i khams la dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de med pa ni 'dod pa'i khams la dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚Äúbecause it focuses on the desire realm.‚Äù

original: mthong ba'i lam ni 'dod pa'i khams la dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam ni 'dod pa'i khams la dmigs pa yin no //
translated: The path of seeing focuses on the desire realm.

original: gzugs med pa dag ni 'dod pa'i khams la dmigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs med pa dag ni 'dod pa'i khams la dmigs pa ma yin te /
translated: The formless realm does not focus on the desire realm.

original: de dag ni rten ring ba la sogs pa dag gis ring ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni rten ring ba la sogs pa dag gis ring ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the formless realm is distant from the desire realm in terms of basis and so on, it is distant.

original: mthong ba'i lam 'dod pa'i khams la dmigs pa yin no zhes bya bar ji ltar shes she na /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam 'dod pa'i khams la dmigs pa yin no zhes bya bar ji ltar shes she na /
translated: How do you know that the path of seeing focuses on the desire realm?

original: de'i phyir de yang sngar yongs su shes par bya zhing spang ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de yang sngar yongs su shes par bya zhing spang ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it is said, ‚ÄúBecause it is previously known and abandoned.‚Äù

analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams ni rags pa'i phyir gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams kyi sngar yongs su shes par bya zhing spang bar bya ba yin no //

translated: One who has entered there is one who has entered the state of an arhat.üîΩOne who has entered there

original: skye bzhin pa'i mar mes mun pa sel cing 'gag bzhin pas sdong bu dang mar bsregs pa de bzhin du sdug bsngal la chos shes pa skye bzhin pas so so'i skye bo nyid spong la /
analyzed: skye bzhin pa'i mar mes mun pa sel cing 'gag bzhin pas sdong bu dang mar bsregs pa de bzhin du sdug bsngal la chos shes pa skye bzhin pas so so'i skye bo nyid spong la /
translated: Just as a lamp arises and removes darkness and just as a lamp that is ceasing burns the wick and oil, so too the arising of the knowledge of the truth of suffering abandons being an ordinary being.

original: 'gag bzhin pas phra rgyas bcu spong ngo //
analyzed: 'gag bzhin pas phra rgyas bcu spong ngo //
translated: Just as a lamp that is arising illuminates and a lamp that is ceasing burns up the wick and oil, so too, the knowledge of the truth of suffering that is arising abandons the state of being an ordinary being and the knowledge of the truth of suffering that is ceasing abandons the ten negative tendencies.

original: gzhan dag na re 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog rnams kyis zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog rnams kyis zhes bya ba la /
translated: Others say: The state of being an ordinary being is reversed by the supreme mundane state.

original: ci zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: so so'i skye bo nyid bzlog go zhes bya ba skabs dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo nyid bzlog go zhes bya ba skabs dang sbyar ro //
translated: The state of being an ordinary being is reversed.üîΩThat is not so, because it is a phenomenon of that.

original: ma yin te de'i chos yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni so so'i skye bo'i chos yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste so so'i skye bo'i chos de nyid bzlog pa mi srid do //
analyzed: ma yin te de'i chos yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni so so'i skye bo'i chos yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste so so'i skye bo'i chos de nyid bzlog pa mi srid do //
translated: That is to say, it is a phenomenon of an ordinary being, and it is impossible to reverse that phenomenon of an ordinary being.üîΩThere is no fault because it is incompatible with that.

original: de dang 'gal ba'i phyir nyes pa med de zhes bya ba ni de dag so so'i chos yin mod kyi /
analyzed: de dang 'gal ba'i phyir nyes pa med de zhes bya ba ni de dag so so'i chos yin mod kyi /
translated: That is to say, it is indeed a phenomenon of an ordinary being,

original: 'on kyang so so'i skye bo nyid dang 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang so so'i skye bo nyid dang 'gal ba yin no //
translated: but it is incompatible with the state of being an ordinary being.

original: dgra bo'i phrag pa la @169a * //
analyzed: dgra bo'i phrag pa la @169a * //
translated: It is like someone who mounts the shoulders of an enemy and kills him.

original: zhon nas de 'tshog pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dper na 'ga' zhig dgra bo'i phrag pa la zhon te /üîΩdgra 'tshog pa de bzhin du so so'i skye bo nyid kyi dgra la zhon te /
analyzed: zhon nas de 'tshog pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dper na 'ga' zhig dgra bo'i phrag pa la zhon te / dgra 'tshog pa de bzhin du so so'i skye bo nyid kyi dgra la zhon te /
translated: For example, someone mounts the shoulders of an enemy and kills him.

original: so so'i skye bo de nyid 'joms par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo de nyid 'joms par byed pa yin no //
translated: Similarly, one mounts the shoulders of the enemy that is the state of an ordinary being and kills that ordinary being.

original: gzhan dag na re gnyi gas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re gnyi gas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Others say: Both the supreme mundane state and the path of seeing

original: 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog rnams dang bzod pas so so'i skye bo nyid bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog rnams dang bzod pas so so'i skye bo nyid bzlog pa'o //
translated: repel the state of an ordinary being.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: bar chad med pa dang rnam par grol ba'i lam dang chos mthun pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /üîΩ'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog rnams ni bar chad med pa'i lam dang 'dra ba yin te /
analyzed: bar chad med pa dang rnam par grol ba'i lam dang chos mthun pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te / 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog rnams ni bar chad med pa'i lam dang 'dra ba yin te /
translated: They say: Because they are similar to the uninterrupted and liberated paths.

original: de thob pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de thob pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The supreme mundane state is similar to the uninterrupted path because it is incompatible with the state of an ordinary being.

original: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa ni rnam par grol ba'i lam dang 'dra ba yin te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa ni rnam par grol ba'i lam dang 'dra ba yin te /
translated: The perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering is similar to the liberated path because it is the first to directly realize the truth of suffering.

original: de mi ldan pa dang lhan cig skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de mi ldan pa dang lhan cig skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not concomitant with that.

original: de nas ni de nyid la chos shes zhes bya ba la chos shes pa ni chos tsam nges par 'dzin par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de nas ni de nyid la chos shes zhes bya ba la chos shes pa ni chos tsam nges par 'dzin par byed pa'o //
translated: Then, knowledge of the truth of the dharma is knowledge of the dharma alone.

original: dang po nyid du chos kyi de kho na nyid shes pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams kyi de kho na nyid ni phyin ci ma log pa'i phyir mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba la sogs pa yin la /
analyzed: dang po nyid du chos kyi de kho na nyid shes pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams kyi de kho na nyid ni phyin ci ma log pa'i phyir mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba la sogs pa yin la /
translated: Because it is the first knowledge of the reality of the dharma, the reality of dharmas with outflows is impermanence, suffering, and so on, because it is unmistaken.

original: de rtogs pa'i phyir sdug bsngal la chos shes pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de rtogs pa'i phyir sdug bsngal la chos shes pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Because it comprehends that, it is called knowledge of the dharma in regard to suffering.

original: de kho na nyid kyi sgra mi mngon par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de kho na nyid kyi sgra mi mngon par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The term ‚Äúreality‚Äù is not explicitly stated.

original: de bzhin du kun 'byung ba la sogs pa dag la yang ci rigs par brjod par bya'o //üîΩrjes su shes pa yang chos kyi de kho na nyid shes pa yin mod kyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du kun 'byung ba la sogs pa dag la yang ci rigs par brjod par bya'o // rjes su shes pa yang chos kyi de kho na nyid shes pa yin mod kyi /
translated: The same should be said for the origin and so on, as appropriate.

original: dang po nyid du ni ma yin pas chos shes pa zhes mi bya'o //
analyzed: dang po nyid du ni ma yin pas chos shes pa zhes mi bya'o //
translated: Subsequent knowledge is also knowledge of the reality of the dharma, but it is not called knowledge of the dharma because it is not the first.

original: de'i rgyu las byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i rgyu las byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because it arises from its cause.üîΩ

original: de'i rgyu can yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: de'i rgyu can yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: Because it arises from that cause means because it is caused by that.üîΩJust as the dharma knowledge comprehends and fully understands the truth of suffering of the desire realm and so on through the aspects of suffering and so forth, so too it is subsequent knowledge because it comprehends the suffering of the form and formless realms.

original: ji ltar chos shes pas 'dod pa'i sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa la sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i rnam pa dag tu rtogs shing yongs su shes pa de kho na bzhin du gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal rtogs pa'i phyir rjes su shesüîΩpa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar chos shes pas 'dod pa'i sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa la sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i rnam pa dag tu rtogs shing yongs su shes pa de kho na bzhin du gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal rtogs pa'i phyir rjes su shes pa yin no //
translated: Just as the dharma knowledge comprehends the truth of origin of the desire realm and so on through the aspects of origin and so forth, so too it is subsequent knowledge because it comprehends the origin of the form and formless realms.

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: Just as the dharma knowledge comprehends the truth of cessation of the desire realm and so on through the aspects of cessation and so forth, so too it is subsequent knowledge because it comprehends the cessation of the form and formless realms.üîΩJust as the dharma knowledge comprehends the truth of path of the desire realm and so on through the aspects of path and so forth, so too it is subsequent knowledge because it comprehends the path of the form and formless realms.

original: mjug thogs su skye ba'i rim gyis zhes bya ba ni mjug thogs su skye ba'i rim pa ste /üîΩde nas so //
analyzed: mjug thogs su skye ba'i rim gyis zhes bya ba ni mjug thogs su skye ba'i rim pa ste / de nas so //
translated: The order in which they arise is the order in which they arise immediately after.

original: lhag ma la zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i kun 'byung ba la'o //
analyzed: lhag ma la zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i kun 'byung ba la'o //
translated: The remaining truths are the truths of origin and so on of the form and formless realms.

original: sde pa gzhan dag ces bya ba ni 'phags pa chos srung ba'i sde pa la sogs pa dag bden pa rnams mngon par rtogs pa gcig tu brjod do //
analyzed: sde pa gzhan dag ces bya ba ni 'phags pa chos srung ba'i sde pa la sogs pa dag bden pa rnams mngon par rtogs pa gcig tu brjod do //
translated: The other schools, namely the Dharmaguptakas, etc., maintain that the direct realization of the truths is single.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: kha cig gi ltar na sdug bsngal shes pa kho nas 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi rtogs pas mngon par rtogs @169b pa gcig pa ni skad cig ma gcig mngon par rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: kha cig gi ltar na sdug bsngal shes pa kho nas 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi rtogs pas mngon par rtogs @169b pa gcig pa ni skad cig ma gcig mngon par rtogs pa yin no //
translated: According to some, the direct realization is single, i.e., in a single moment, because one realizes the four truths through the single cognition of the truth of unsatisfactoriness.

original: kha cig gi ni skad cig ma bzhi ste /
analyzed: kha cig gi ni skad cig ma bzhi ste /
translated: According to others, it is in four moments,

original: de dag la mnyam par bzhag pa dang / mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i dbye ba ma byas par bden pa bzhi la shes pa'i skad cig ma bzhi'o //
analyzed: de dag la mnyam par bzhag pa dang / mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i dbye ba ma byas par bden pa bzhi la shes pa'i skad cig ma bzhi'o //
translated: because there are four moments of cognition of the truths without taking into account the distinction of the concentrated and non-concentrated states.

original: kha cig gi brgyad de /
analyzed: kha cig gi brgyad de /
translated: According to others, it is in eight moments,

original: 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i bden pa'i dbye ba dang / chos rjes su shes pa'i dbye bas brgyad yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i bden pa'i dbye ba dang / chos rjes su shes pa'i dbye bas brgyad yin no //
translated: because there are eight moments of cognition of the truths, by distinguishing the truths of the realm of desire, the realm of fine-materiality and the realm of immateriality, and by distinguishing the subsequent cognition.

original: kha cig gi ni skad cig ma bcu gnyis te /
analyzed: kha cig gi ni skad cig ma bcu gnyis te /
translated: According to others, it is in twelve moments,

original: skad cig ma brgyad po de dag kho na la gzhan 'jig rten pa'i shes pa bzhi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: skad cig ma brgyad po de dag kho na la gzhan 'jig rten pa'i shes pa bzhi 'byung ngo //
translated: These eight moments are the four mundane cognitions.

original: de ltar sde pa gzhan dag gi blo tha dad par gyur to //
analyzed: de ltar sde pa gzhan dag gi blo tha dad par gyur to //
translated: Thus, the other schools have different ideas.

original: bye brag med par mngon par rtogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bye brag med par mngon par rtogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The realization is called ‚Äúwithout distinction.‚Äù

original: de ni rnam pa gsum ste zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa gsum ste zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is of three kinds,

original: mthong ba'i mngon par rtogs pa dang / dmigs pa'i mngon par rtogs pa dang / bya ba'i mngon par rtogs pa'o //üîΩmthong ba'i mngon par rtogs pa ni zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mthong ba'i mngon par rtogs pa dang / dmigs pa'i mngon par rtogs pa dang / bya ba'i mngon par rtogs pa'o // mthong ba'i mngon par rtogs pa ni zhes bya ba ni /
translated: the realization of seeing, the realization of the object, and the realization of action.üîΩThe realization of seeing is

original: mthong ba nyid mngon par rtogs pa yin pa ni /
analyzed: mthong ba nyid mngon par rtogs pa yin pa ni /
translated: the realization of seeing itself.

original: bden pa mngon par rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: bden pa mngon par rtogs pa ste /
translated: The realization of the truths isüîΩthe realization of seeing, because without wisdom there is no seeing of the truths.

original: 'di ltar shes rab med dang bden pa rnams mthong ba med pas de'i phyir mthong ba'i mngon par rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar shes rab med dang bden pa rnams mthong ba med pas de'i phyir mthong ba'i mngon par rtogs pa yin no //
translated: The realization of the object isüîΩthe realization of the object itself.üîΩThe realization of the object is the realization of the object, because without the object there is no realization of the object.

original: zag pa med pa'i shes rab kyis bden pa rnams zhes bya ba ni dge slong dag zag pa med pa'i shes rab kyis mthong ba gang yin pa de ni mthong ba'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i shes rab kyis bden pa rnams zhes bya ba ni dge slong dag zag pa med pa'i shes rab kyis mthong ba gang yin pa de ni mthong ba'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The wisdom that is uncontaminated is called the truth of the path, because it is said, ‚ÄúMonks, that which is seen by uncontaminated wisdom is seeing.‚Äù

original: dmigs pa'i mngon par rtogs pa ni dmigs pa'i mngon par rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i mngon par rtogs pa ni dmigs pa'i mngon par rtogs pa ste /
translated: Realization of the object is realization of the object.

original: 'dir dmigs pa ni 'dzin pa la 'dod do //
analyzed: 'dir dmigs pa ni 'dzin pa la 'dod do //
translated: Here, the object is asserted to be the object of observation.

original: gal te dmigs pa 'dzin pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te dmigs pa 'dzin pa yin na /
translated: If the object is the object of observation,

original: mthong ba dang dmigs pa gnyis la khyad par ci yod ce na /
analyzed: mthong ba dang dmigs pa gnyis la khyad par ci yod ce na /
translated: what is the difference between seeing and the object?

original: shes rab kho nas mthong ba yin la /
analyzed: shes rab kho nas mthong ba yin la /
translated: Seeing is by wisdom alone.

original: shes rab dang mtshungs par ldan pa dag gis dmigs pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni khyad par yin no //
analyzed: shes rab dang mtshungs par ldan pa dag gis dmigs pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni khyad par yin no //
translated: The object is by that which is concomitant with wisdom. This is the difference.

original: de ltar byas dang / dmigs pa'i mngon par rtogs pa ni de dang mtshungs par ldan pa rnams kyis kyang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de ltar byas dang / dmigs pa'i mngon par rtogs pa ni de dang mtshungs par ldan pa rnams kyis kyang zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: If that is so, then the object of observation is also by that which is concomitant with it.

original: kyang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni shes rab kyang gzung ngo //
analyzed: kyang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni shes rab kyang gzung ngo //
translated: The word also includes wisdom.

original: de'i phyir de ltar na re zhig mthong ba gang yin pa de ni dmigs pa yang yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar na re zhig mthong ba gang yin pa de ni dmigs pa yang yin la /
translated: Therefore, in this way, that which is seen is also the object of observation.

original: tshor ba la sogs pa'i dmigs pa ni mthong ba ma yin no //
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa'i dmigs pa ni mthong ba ma yin no //
translated: The object of observation of feeling, etc. is not seen.

original: bya ba nyid mngon par rtogs pa yin pa ni bya ba'i mngon par rtogs pa yin pa'am /
analyzed: bya ba nyid mngon par rtogs pa yin pa ni bya ba'i mngon par rtogs pa yin pa'am /
translated: The clear realization of activity is the clear realization of activity.

original: yang na bden pa gsum gyi bya ba gang yin pa bya ba yin te /
analyzed: yang na bden pa gsum gyi bya ba gang yin pa bya ba yin te /
translated: Or, that which is the activity of the three truths is activity.

original: de yang mjug thogs su 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang mjug thogs su 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: That will be explained immediately following this.

original: ldan pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ldan pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúnot conjoined‚Äù is explained.

original: kyang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni mtshungs par ldan pa dang / shes rab kyis kyang yin pa'o //
analyzed: kyang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni mtshungs par ldan pa dang / shes rab kyis kyang yin pa'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù indicates that it is also by concomitant and wisdom.

analyzed: sdug bsngal yongs su shes na the tshom kun du 'byung ba yod pa ma yin te /

original: de'i tshe gdon mi za bar spangs pa yang yin te /
analyzed: de'i tshe gdon mi za bar spangs pa yang yin te /

original: de'i phyir mdo dang 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir mdo dang 'gal ba med do //

original: de dag ni sa drug go zhes sngar bshad zin to zhes bya ba ni mi lcogs pa med pa dang / khyad par bsam gtan sa pa'o zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni sa drug go zhes sngar bshad zin to zhes bya ba ni mi lcogs pa med pa dang / khyad par bsam gtan sa pa'o zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: As for the six stages, it was previously explained that the uninterrupted path of the path of seeing is the stage of heat, the supreme mundane state is the stage of peak, the uninterrupted path of the path of meditation is the stage of patience, and the liberated path of the path of meditation is the stage of world-transcending supreme dharma.

original: gnyis kyi rkun po 'byin pa dang sgo gcod pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni bar chad med pa'i lam gyis nyon mongs pa'i chom rkun de'i thob pa gcod pa'i sgo nas 'byin par byed la /

analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i lam gyis ni da ltar du byed pa'i sgo nas bral ba'i thob pa'i sgo gcod par byed do //

original: shes pa'i bzod pa @172a * //
analyzed: shes pa'i bzod pa @172a * //
translated: Similarly, the second uninterrupted path of perseverance for subsequent knowledge of the truth of suffering is perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of origin.

original: yin te / lhag ma dag la yang de dang 'dra bar brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: yin te / lhag ma dag la yang de dang 'dra bar brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same should be said for the remaining truths.

original: dmigs pa de kho na la the tshom spangs pa'i shes pa skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gang zhig bar chad med pa'i lam gyi yul 'dod pa'i sdug bsngal la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa de kho na la the tshom spangs pa'i shes pa skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gang zhig bar chad med pa'i lam gyi yul 'dod pa'i sdug bsngal la sogs pa la'o //
translated: This refers to the object of the uninterrupted path, such as the suffering of the desire realm.

original: de las cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de las cir 'gyur zhe na /

original: phyis sdug bsngal yongs su shes so zhes bya bar nges par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: phyis sdug bsngal yongs su shes so zhes bya bar nges par mi 'gyur te /

analyzed: de'i yul can gyi shes pa sngar ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //

original: de nye bar bstan pa don med pa yang thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nye bar bstan pa don med pa yang thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: It would also follow that the teaching of that would be pointless.

original: re zhig 'di ni rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: re zhig 'di ni rigs pa yin no //
translated: This is the reasoning.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang sdug bsngal la chos shes pa dang / sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang sdug bsngal la chos shes pa dang / sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa zhes gsungs te /
translated: The Bhagav√•n also said, Knowledge of the Dharma with regard to suffering and subsequent knowledge with regard to suffering.

original: de'i phyir gdon mi za bar gnyi ga yang yod dgos so //üîΩgal te bzod pa rnams kyis nyon mongs spong ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir gdon mi za bar gnyi ga yang yod dgos so // gal te bzod pa rnams kyis nyon mongs spong ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Therefore, both must exist without a doubt.üîΩIf the afflictions are abandoned by the acceptances,

original: gal te bzod pa rnams kyis nyon mongs pa spong la /
analyzed: gal te bzod pa rnams kyis nyon mongs pa spong la /
translated: if the afflictions are abandoned by the acceptances,

analyzed: shes pa rnams kyis ma yin zhing shes pa rnams kyis de'i bral ba'i thob pa 'dzin pa 'ba' zhig yin na /

analyzed: de lta na bstan bcos las kun du sbyor ba'i ris dgu zhes 'byung ba dang 'gal te / 'di skad du bstan bcos las kun du sbyor ba'i ris dgu ste /

original: chos shes pa spang bar bya ba bzhi dang / rjes su shes pas spang bar bya ba bzhi dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'o zhes 'don to //
analyzed: chos shes pa spang bar bya ba bzhi dang / rjes su shes pas spang bar bya ba bzhi dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'o zhes 'don to //
translated: Four are to be abandoned by the path of Dharma knowledge and four are to be abandoned by the path of subsequent knowledge and one is to be abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: ma yin te bzod pa rnams ni shes pa'i 'khor yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'gal ba yod pa ma yin pa'o //üîΩbzod pa rnams ni shes pa'i 'khor du gyur pas de'i phyir bzod pas spang bar bya ba'i kun du sbyor ba'i ris la shes pas spang bar bya ba zhes bya ba ste /

original: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i kun du sbyor ba'i ris ni gtsor shes pas spang bar bya ba kho na yin no //
analyzed: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i kun du sbyor ba'i ris ni gtsor shes pas spang bar bya ba kho na yin no //

original: de nyid la dper brjod pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid la dper brjod pa ni /
translated: An example of that is

analyzed: rgyal po'i 'khor gyis byas pa las rgyal pos byas so zhes tha snyad 'dogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smos so //

original: bden pa ma mthong ba mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi ma mthong ba rnams mthong ba'i phyir mthong ba'i lam zhes bya ste /
