original: lam la rjes su shes pa ma gtogs pa skad cig ma lhag ma bco ldan ni mthong ba'i lam mo //
analyzed: lam la rjes su shes pa ma gtogs pa skad cig ma lhag ma bco ldan ni mthong ba'i lam mo //
translated: The path of seeing is the remaining moments of the uninterrupted and liberated paths, except for the subsequent knowledge of the truth of the path.üîΩBecause it cultivates what was seen.

original: ji ltar mthong ba goms par byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni lam la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pas mthong ba'i lam la rjes su shes pas mthong bas ji ltar mthong ba goms par byed pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar mthong ba goms par byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni lam la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pas mthong ba'i lam la rjes su shes pas mthong bas ji ltar mthong ba goms par byed pa'o //
translated: The path of cultivation is so called because the subsequent perseverance for subsequent knowledge of the truth of the path cultivates what was seen by the subsequent knowledge of the truth of the path on the path of seeing.

original: mthong ba mthong ba ma yin nam zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma bcu drug pa des so//
analyzed: mthong ba mthong ba ma yin nam zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma bcu drug pa des so//
translated: This is the sixteenth moment.

original: @172b ma mthong ba de gang zhig ce na /
analyzed: @172b ma mthong ba de gang zhig ce na /
translated: What is not seeing?

original: lam la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: lam la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The term ‚Äúacceptance of subsequent knowledge of the truth of the path‚Äù is stated.

original: lam la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa ni bdag nyid ma gtogs pa lhag ma rjes su shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i lam la dmigs par byed do /
analyzed: lam la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa ni bdag nyid ma gtogs pa lhag ma rjes su shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i lam la dmigs par byed do /
translated: Acceptance of subsequent knowledge of the truth of the path focuses on the path that is compatible with subsequent knowledge, excluding itself.

original: bdag nyid la byed pa ni 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid la byed pa ni 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It does not focus on itself because that would be contradictory.

original: phyis rjes su mthun pa'i shes pas bzod pa ma mthong ba de dag mthong ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: phyis rjes su mthun pa'i shes pas bzod pa ma mthong ba de dag mthong ba yin no zhe na /
translated: Later, subsequent knowledge sees what was not seen by acceptance.

original: bden pa'i phyir la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: bden pa'i phyir la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: Because it is true, etc.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bden pa ma mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba gsungs kyi /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bden pa ma mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba gsungs kyi /
translated: It is said that because the truth was not seen,

original: ma mthong ba mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ma mthong ba mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes pa ni ma yin no //
translated: but it is not said that what was not seen was seen.

original: de nyid kyi phyir skad cig ma gcig ma mthong nas ni bden pa mthong ba ma yin te zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir skad cig ma gcig ma mthong nas ni bden pa mthong ba ma yin te zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore he says, ‚ÄúOne does not see the truth by not seeing one moment.‚Äù

original: 'jig rten pa'i dper bshad pa ni dper na nyag ma gcig ma brdas pas zhing ma brngas pa yin pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i dper bshad pa ni dper na nyag ma gcig ma brdas pas zhing ma brngas pa yin pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The mundane example is, ‚ÄúFor example, it is like a field that is not plowed because one seed has not been planted.‚Äù

original: 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni lam la rjes su shes pa ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bus bsdus pa yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni lam la rjes su shes pa ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bus bsdus pa yin te /
translated: Because it is a result means that subsequent knowledge of the truth of the path is subsumed by the result of stream entry.

original: de'i phyir 'bras bu yin pas lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la sogs pa bzhin du bsgom pa'i lam yin no zhes bya bar nges so //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'bras bu yin pas lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la sogs pa bzhin du bsgom pa'i lam yin no zhes bya bar nges so //
translated: Therefore, because it is a result, it is the path of meditation, just like the result of once-returner and so on.

original: shes pa brgyad dang rnam pa bcu drug thob pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni lam la rjes su shes pa'i tshe shes pa brgyad dang rnam pa bcu drug 'thob pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: shes pa brgyad dang rnam pa bcu drug thob pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni lam la rjes su shes pa'i tshe shes pa brgyad dang rnam pa bcu drug 'thob pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because one obtains eight knowledges and sixteen aspects means that at the time of subsequent knowledge of the truth of the path, one obtains eight knowledges and sixteen aspects.

original: chos shes pa bzhi dang rjes su shes pa bzhi dang / rnam pa bcu drug zhes bya ba /
analyzed: chos shes pa bzhi dang rjes su shes pa bzhi dang / rnam pa bcu drug zhes bya ba /
translated: The four knowledges of the truths, the four subsequent knowledges, and the sixteen aspects.

original: sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa bzhi nas lam gyi rnam pa bzhi'i bar te de las gzhan pa'i bsgom pa'i lam bzhin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa bzhi nas lam gyi rnam pa bzhi'i bar te de las gzhan pa'i bsgom pa'i lam bzhin no //
translated: The sixteen aspects are the four aspects of each of the four truths, such as impermanence and so on.

original: mthong ba'i lam la ni shes pa dang rnam pa skal ba mnyam pa kho na 'thob po //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam la ni shes pa dang rnam pa skal ba mnyam pa kho na 'thob po //
translated: On the path of seeing, one obtains knowledge and aspects of the same level.

original: de'i phyir yang lam la rjes su shes pa ni bsgom pa'i lam kho na yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang lam la rjes su shes pa ni bsgom pa'i lam kho na yin no //
translated: Therefore, subsequent knowledge of the truth of the path is the path of meditation alone.

original: lam snga ma rnam par nyams pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni zhugs pa'i lam rnam par nyams pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: lam snga ma rnam par nyams pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni zhugs pa'i lam rnam par nyams pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because the former path degenerates means because the path of entry degenerates.

original: lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'i lam ltar bsgom pa'i lam kho nar zhugs pa'i lam yongs su gtong gi mthong ba'i lam du ni ma yin la /
analyzed: lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'i lam ltar bsgom pa'i lam kho nar zhugs pa'i lam yongs su gtong gi mthong ba'i lam du ni ma yin la /
translated: The path of meditation alone relinquishes the path of entry, as in the case of the result of once-returner and nonreturner, but not the path of seeing.

original: lam la rjes su shes pa la ni zhugs pa'i yongs su gtong ba yin te /
analyzed: lam la rjes su shes pa la ni zhugs pa'i yongs su gtong ba yin te /
translated: Subsequent knowledge of the truth of the path relinquishes the path of entry.

original: de'i phyir yang bsgom pa'i lam kho na yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang bsgom pa'i lam kho na yin no //
translated: Therefore it is the path of meditation alone.

original: rgyun chags pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ni lam la rjes su shes pa 'di ni de las gzhan pa'i bsgom pa'i lam bzhin du /
analyzed: rgyun chags pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ni lam la rjes su shes pa 'di ni de las gzhan pa'i bsgom pa'i lam bzhin du /
translated: Because it is continuous means that subsequent knowledge of the truth of the path is continuous, like the path of meditation that is other than it.

original: rgyun chags pa yin na mthong ba'i lam la ni bzod pa 'am shes pa 'ang rung rgyun chags pa yod pa ma yin @173a * //
analyzed: rgyun chags pa yin na mthong ba'i lam la ni bzod pa 'am shes pa 'ang rung rgyun chags pa yod pa ma yin @173a * //
translated: But in the path of seeing, there is no continuity of either perseverance or knowledge.

original: te ; 'di'i phyir yang lam la rjes su shes pa bsgom pa'i lam yin no //
analyzed: te ; 'di'i phyir yang lam la rjes su shes pa bsgom pa'i lam yin no //
translated: Therefore subsequent knowledge of the truth of the path is the path of meditation.

original: gal te lam la rjes su shes pa bsgom pa'i lam yin na /
analyzed: gal te lam la rjes su shes pa bsgom pa'i lam yin na /
translated: If subsequent knowledge of the truth of the path is the path of meditation,

original: ji ltar de las yongs su mi nyams she na /üîΩde'i phyir yongs su mi nyams pa ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i spangs pa yang dag par 'dzin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ji ltar de las yongs su mi nyams she na / de'i phyir yongs su mi nyams pa ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i spangs pa yang dag par 'dzin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: how does one not regress from it?üîΩTo explain this, he says, because it fully possesses the abandonment that is to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i spangs pa yang dag par 'dzin par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i spangs pa yang dag par 'dzin par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: It fully possesses the abandonment that is to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: gzhi'i gnyen po ni rnam par grol ba'i lam mo zhes sngar mdzod kyi gnas lnga par bshad zin to //
analyzed: gzhi'i gnyen po ni rnam par grol ba'i lam mo zhes sngar mdzod kyi gnas lnga par bshad zin to //
translated: The antidote of the path of seeing is the liberated path.

original: lam la rjes su shes pa kho nas mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams kyi spangs pa yang dag par 'dzin pa de'i de las yongs su nyams pa med do //
analyzed: lam la rjes su shes pa kho nas mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams kyi spangs pa yang dag par 'dzin pa de'i de las yongs su nyams pa med do //
translated: The correct acquisition of the abandonment of objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing through subsequent knowledge of the truth of the path alone is not lost.

original: gal te 'bras bu'i lam de las yongs su nyams na ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu las kyang yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba zhig na de las ni yongs su nyams pa med do //
analyzed: gal te 'bras bu'i lam de las yongs su nyams na ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu las kyang yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba zhig na de las ni yongs su nyams pa med do //
translated: If one were to lose that path of the result, one would also lose the result of stream entry, but one does not lose that.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mthong ba'i lam yin no zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir des mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i spangs ba yang dag par 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mthong ba'i lam yin no zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir des mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i spangs ba yang dag par 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore it is the path of seeing because it correctly acquires the abandonment of objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing.üîΩIt is not, because that would be illogical.

original: ma yin te ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni lam la rjes su shes pa phan chad kyi bsgom pa'i lam yang mthong ba'i lam du 'gyur te /
analyzed: ma yin te ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni lam la rjes su shes pa phan chad kyi bsgom pa'i lam yang mthong ba'i lam du 'gyur te /
translated: The path of meditation that is subsequent to subsequent knowledge of the truth of the path would also be the path of seeing.

original: des kyang mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i spangs ba yang dag par 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des kyang mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i spangs ba yang dag par 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it correctly grasps the abandonment that is to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: de ltar yin na ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la sogs pa yang mthong ba'i lam du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar yin na ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la sogs pa yang mthong ba'i lam du 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, then the result of once-returner and so on would also be the path of seeing.

original: ci'i phyir shes pa bdun mthong ba'i lam yin zhe na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ci'i phyir shes pa bdun mthong ba'i lam yin zhe na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Why are the seven called the path of seeing?

original: brgyad pa lam la rjes su shes pa ma yin snyam du bsams pa ste /
analyzed: brgyad pa lam la rjes su shes pa ma yin snyam du bsams pa ste /
translated: One should think that the eighth is not subsequent knowledge of the truth of the path.

original: bdun po de dag ni chos shes pa bzhi dang / rjes su shes pa gsum mo //
analyzed: bdun po de dag ni chos shes pa bzhi dang / rjes su shes pa gsum mo //
translated: The seven are the four knowledges of the truths and the three subsequent knowledges.

original: mthong ba ma rdzogs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mthong ba ma rdzogs pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because seeing is not complete.

original: bden pa ma mthong ba mthong ba'i phyir shes pa rnams mthong ba'i lam nyid do zhes mi bya'i /
analyzed: bden pa ma mthong ba mthong ba'i phyir shes pa rnams mthong ba'i lam nyid do zhes mi bya'i /
translated: It is not said that the knowledges are the path of seeing because seeing the truths that were not seen is complete.

original: 'o na ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If that is so, why are they?

original: mthong ba'i lam gyi bar mar gyur pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam gyi bar mar gyur pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because they are the middle of the path of seeing.

original: bzod pa gnyis gnyis kyi bar mar gyur pa yin pa'i phyir shes pa bdun po de dag kyang mthong ba'i lam yin no ;
analyzed: bzod pa gnyis gnyis kyi bar mar gyur pa yin pa'i phyir shes pa bdun po de dag kyang mthong ba'i lam yin no ;
translated: Because they are the middle of the two forbearances, those seven knowledges are the path of seeing.

original: / da ni ji ltar na 'phags pa'i lam skyes pa'i gang zag rnams zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: / da ni ji ltar na 'phags pa'i lam skyes pa'i gang zag rnams zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: Now, how are the persons who have generated the ƒÅrya path explained in detail?

original: lam ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: lam ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The path is threefold:

original: mthong ba'i lam dang / bsgom pa'i lam dang / mi slob pa'i lam ste /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam dang / bsgom pa'i lam dang / mi slob pa'i lam ste /
translated: the path of seeing, the path of cultivation, and the path of no-more-learning.

original: da ni gsum po de dag tu ji ltar gang zag rnam par gzhag par de ltar rgyas par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: da ni gsum po de dag tu ji ltar gang zag rnam par gzhag par de ltar rgyas par brjod par bya'o //
translated: Now, how are the persons established in these three? This will be explained in detail.

original: @173b de la re zhig mthong ba'i lam gyi rang bzhin gyi zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: @173b de la re zhig mthong ba'i lam gyi rang bzhin gyi zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: First, the one who is on the path of seeing is explained in detail.

original: dbang po rtul po ni dad pas nus pa kun du 'byung ba'i phyir skad cig ma bco lnga po de dag la gnas pa na dad pa'i rjes su 'brang ba zhes bya 'o //
analyzed: dbang po rtul po ni dad pas nus pa kun du 'byung ba'i phyir skad cig ma bco lnga po de dag la gnas pa na dad pa'i rjes su 'brang ba zhes bya 'o //
translated: The dull faculty person is called a faith-follower because faith is predominant in the fifteen moments.

original: dbang po rnon po ni dpyod pa dag gis mngon par dga' ba kun du 'byung ba'i phyir chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba zhes bya'o //üîΩrjes su 'brang bas na /
analyzed: dbang po rnon po ni dpyod pa dag gis mngon par dga' ba kun du 'byung ba'i phyir chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba zhes bya'o // rjes su 'brang bas na /
translated: The sharp faculty person is called a Dharma-follower because delight in investigation is predominant.üîΩThey follow after,

original: rjes su 'brang ba ste /
analyzed: rjes su 'brang ba ste /
translated: so they are followers.

original: dngos po'i byed pa po'o //
analyzed: dngos po'i byed pa po'o //
translated: He is the agent of the thing.

original: dad pa'i rjes su 'brang bas na dad pa'i rjes su 'brang ba'o //
analyzed: dad pa'i rjes su 'brang bas na dad pa'i rjes su 'brang ba'o //
translated: One who follows faith is a follower by faith.

original: de la 'di yod pas na dad pa'i rjes su 'brang ba'o //
analyzed: de la 'di yod pas na dad pa'i rjes su 'brang ba'o //
translated: Because he has that, he is a follower by faith.

original: sngon gzhan las yid ches pas don gyi rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni bden pa mthong ba'i sngon rol du ste /
analyzed: sngon gzhan las yid ches pas don gyi rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni bden pa mthong ba'i sngon rol du ste /
translated: Because he previously followed the meaning through faith in another,

original: bden pa mthong na ni bdag nyid kyis mngon sum du byed pa yin no //
analyzed: bden pa mthong na ni bdag nyid kyis mngon sum du byed pa yin no //
translated: but when he sees the truths, he does it by himself.üîΩOne who follows reality is a follower by the dharma.

original: chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba yang de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni chos kyi rjes su 'brang bas na chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba'o //üîΩde 'di la yod pas sam /
analyzed: chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba yang de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni chos kyi rjes su 'brang bas na chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba'o // de 'di la yod pas sam /
translated: Because he has that, he is a follower by the dharma.

original: chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i ngang tshul can yin pas na chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba ste /
analyzed: chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i ngang tshul can yin pas na chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba ste /
translated: Or, because he has the nature of a follower by the dharma.

original: sngon bdag nyid kho nas mdo la sogs pa'i chos gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis kyi don gyi rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon bdag nyid kho nas mdo la sogs pa'i chos gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis kyi don gyi rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he previously followed the meaning by himself through the twelve branches of the scriptures such as the sutras.

original: rnam pa lnga'i bar du spangs pa zhig yin na yang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rnam pa lnga'i bar du spangs pa zhig yin na yang zhes bya ba la /
translated: If he is an abider in the fruit of once-returner who has abandoned from one to five types,üîΩhe is called an enterer to the fruit of nonreturner.

original: bar du zhes bya ba'i sgras ni gcig dang gnyis dang gsum dang bzhi rnam pa lnga spangs pa zhig yin na /
analyzed: bar du zhes bya ba'i sgras ni gcig dang gnyis dang gsum dang bzhi rnam pa lnga spangs pa zhig yin na /
translated: The term ‚Äúup to‚Äù indicates that if he has abandoned one, two, three, or four types,

original: de bzhin du dang po'i 'bras bu ba la zhugs pa dag ces bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du dang po'i 'bras bu ba la zhugs pa dag ces bya ste /
translated: he is also called an enterer to the fruit of nonreturner.

original: dper na 'ching pa mtha' dag dang ldan pa dag bzhin no //üîΩgnyis pa la /üîΩdgu pa tshun chad zad pa yin /
analyzed: dper na 'ching pa mtha' dag dang ldan pa dag bzhin no // gnyis pa la / dgu pa tshun chad zad pa yin /
translated: For example, he is like one who possesses all the bonds.üîΩIf he has abandoned from six to eight types,üîΩhe is called an enterer to the fruit of nonreturner.

original: gnyis pa la zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa'i ched du ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa la zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa'i ched du ste /
translated: ‚ÄúIf he has abandoned from six to eight types‚Äù means that he has abandoned from six to eight types for the sake of the second.

original: dper na pags pa'i phyir gung gsod do zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na pags pa'i phyir gung gsod do zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like saying ‚ÄúHe kills a deer for the sake of its hide.‚ÄùüîΩIt is impossible to attain the state of an arhat in the first moment.

original: dgra bcom pa nyid ni dang po nyid du thob par mi nus te zhes bya ba ni phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu thob pa'i gong rol du dgra bcom pa nyid thob par mi nus so zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid ni dang po nyid du thob par mi nus te zhes bya ba ni phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu thob pa'i gong rol du dgra bcom pa nyid thob par mi nus so zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This means that it is impossible to attain the state of an arhat prior to attaining the fruit of nonreturner.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mthong ba'i lam gyis bsgom pas spang bar bya ba mi spong ba'i phyir dang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam gyis bsgom pas spang bar bya ba mi spong ba'i phyir dang zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Because the path of seeing does not abandon objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: srid pa'i rtse mo'i bsgom pas spang bar bya ba spangs pas dgra bcom pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo'i bsgom pas spang bar bya ba spangs pas dgra bcom pa nyid yin na /
translated: If one is an arhat through abandoning objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation of the summit of existence,

original: mthong ba'i lam gyis bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnams spong ba srid pa yang ma yin te /üîΩbzod pas gzhom min sgom kho nas //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam gyis bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnams spong ba srid pa yang ma yin te / bzod pas gzhom min sgom kho nas //
translated: it is impossible that the path of seeing abandons objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said, ‚ÄúThey are not to be conquered by perseverance, only by meditation.‚Äù

original: sngar yang srid pa'i rtse mo las 'dod chags dang bral ba mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sngon so so'i skye bo'i gnas skabs na @174a * //üîΩ'jig rten pa'i lam gyis srid pa'i rtse mo las 'dod chags dang bral ba mi srid pa'o //
analyzed: sngar yang srid pa'i rtse mo las 'dod chags dang bral ba mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sngon so so'i skye bo'i gnas skabs na @174a * // 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis srid pa'i rtse mo las 'dod chags dang bral ba mi srid pa'o //
translated: And because it is impossible that one previously free from attachment to the summit of existence would be free from attachment to the summit of existence.üîΩIt is impossible that one previously free from attachment to the summit of existence would be free from attachment to the summit of existence through the mundane path.

original: srid pa'i rtse mo'i gnyen por gyur pa'i 'jig rten pa'i lam ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo'i gnyen por gyur pa'i 'jig rten pa'i lam ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: There is no mundane path that serves as an antidote to the summit of existence.

original: 'jig rten pa'i lam ni gong ma'i nyer bsdogs kyis bsdus pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i lam ni gong ma'i nyer bsdogs kyis bsdus pa'i phyir la /
translated: The mundane path is included in the preparatory stage of the higher realm.

original: de yan chad nas gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yan chad nas gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no other path beyond that.

original: dad pa dang shes rab lhag pas mos pa dang / mthong bas rab tu phye ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dad pa dang shes rab lhag pas mos pa dang / mthong bas rab tu phye ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: They are distinguished by faith and wisdom, respectively, because they are distinguished by aspiration and by seeing.

original: dad pa lhag pas mos pas rab tu phye ba'i phyir dad pas mos pa yin gyi de la shes rab med pa nyid ni ma yin la shes rab lhag pas mthong bas rab tu phye ba'i phyir mthong bas thob pa yin gyi de la dad pa med paüîΩni ma yin no //
analyzed: dad pa lhag pas mos pas rab tu phye ba'i phyir dad pas mos pa yin gyi de la shes rab med pa nyid ni ma yin la shes rab lhag pas mthong bas rab tu phye ba'i phyir mthong bas thob pa yin gyi de la dad pa med pa ni ma yin no //
translated: They are distinguished by aspiration because of the predominance of faith. It is not that they have no wisdom. They are distinguished by seeing because of the predominance of wisdom. It is not that they have no faith.

original: rnam pa lnga'i bar bcom zhes bshad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam pa lnga'i bar bcom zhes bshad pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is explained that up to five types are abandoned.

original: ci'i phyir rnam pa lnga spangs kyang sems bcu drug pa la rgyun du zhugs pa kho na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: ci'i phyir rnam pa lnga spangs kyang sems bcu drug pa la rgyun du zhugs pa kho na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: Why is it that one who abandons five types is only a stream enterer on the sixteenth moment?

original: ji srid du khyad par du bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ji srid du khyad par du bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: Up to the point of distinguishing the result, one is called a candidate for the result of stream enterer.

original: khyad par du bya ba'i phyir brtson pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: khyad par du bya ba'i phyir brtson pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is striving for the sake of a special attainment?

original: 'bras bu thob par bya ba la zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: 'bras bu thob par bya ba la zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: It is striving for the attainment of the result.

original: de bzhin du 'bras bu gzhan la yang sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la ste /üîΩci'i phyir sngar 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis rnam pa bdun dang brgyad spangs kyang sems bcu drug pa la lan cig phyir 'ong ba zhes bya la /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'bras bu gzhan la yang sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la ste / ci'i phyir sngar 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis rnam pa bdun dang brgyad spangs kyang sems bcu drug pa la lan cig phyir 'ong ba zhes bya la /
translated: The same should be applied to the other results.

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa zhes mi bya zhe na /
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa zhes mi bya zhe na /
translated: Why is one called a ‚Äúonce-returner‚Äù on the sixteenth thought moment, but not one who has entered the result of non-returner, even though both have abandoned seven or eight types of defilements by the mundane path?

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: Because:

original: 'bras thob 'bras bu khyad par gyi //
analyzed: 'bras thob 'bras bu khyad par gyi //
translated: One who has attained the result does not enter the result.

original: lam thob med pas zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du 'dod pa'i khams na 'dod chags dang bral zhing gong ma ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi bar las 'dod chags dang bral yang sems bcu drug pa la phyir mi 'ong ba kho na zhes bya la /
analyzed: lam thob med pas zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du 'dod pa'i khams na 'dod chags dang bral zhing gong ma ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi bar las 'dod chags dang bral yang sems bcu drug pa la phyir mi 'ong ba kho na zhes bya la /
translated: Similarly, one who is free of attachment to the desire realm and free of attachment to the higher stages up to the base of nothingness is called anƒÅgƒÅmin, a nonreturner, on the sixteenth moment of mind.

original: dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa zhes mi bya zhe na /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa zhes mi bya zhe na /
translated: But one is not called an enterer to the result of an arhat.

original: gang gi phyir 'bras bu thob 'bras bu'i khyad par gyi zhes bya ba rgyas par sbyar ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'bras bu thob 'bras bu'i khyad par gyi zhes bya ba rgyas par sbyar ro //
translated: Because there is no obtainment of the result, one is not called an enterer to the result of a nonreturner.

original: gang zhig bsam gtan gsum pa la 'dod chags dang bral la /
analyzed: gang zhig bsam gtan gsum pa la 'dod chags dang bral la /
translated: One who is free of attachment to the third absorptionüîΩand who is free of attachment to the lower levelüîΩthat is, any of the levels from unrestricted access concentration up to the second absorption

original: sa 'og ma la brten te zhes bya ba ni mi lcogs pa med pa la sogs pa rnams las bsam gtan gnyis pa la thug pa gang yang rung ba zhig la ste /
analyzed: sa 'og ma la brten te zhes bya ba ni mi lcogs pa med pa la sogs pa rnams las bsam gtan gnyis pa la thug pa gang yang rung ba zhig la ste /
translated: is called an enterer to the result of a nonreturner.

original: de dag la bde ba'i dbang po med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag la bde ba'i dbang po med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the faculty of pleasure does not exist on those levels.

original: de ni 'dod pa'i khams su skyes pa kho na zhig ste /
analyzed: de ni 'dod pa'i khams su skyes pa kho na zhig ste /
translated: That person is born only in the desire realm.

original: gong na mthong ba'i lam med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gong na mthong ba'i lam med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no path of seeing above it.

original: de ni gdon mi za bar 'bras bu khyad par can gyi lam bsam gtan gsum pa'i sa pa zag @174b pa med pa mngon du byed do //üîΩde lta ma yin na de'i gong du skyes pa de zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan gsum pa de'i gong bsam gtan bzhi pa'am /
analyzed: de ni gdon mi za bar 'bras bu khyad par can gyi lam bsam gtan gsum pa'i sa pa zag @174b pa med pa mngon du byed do // de lta ma yin na de'i gong du skyes pa de zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan gsum pa de'i gong bsam gtan bzhi pa'am /
translated: Undoubtedly, they manifest the uncontaminated third absorption that is the path of superior result.

original: gzugs med pa dag tu skyes pa'i 'phags pa de bde ba'i dbang po dang mi ldan par 'gyur ro //üîΩdes ni sa 'phos pas bsam gtan gsum pa zag pa dang bcas pa btang la /
analyzed: gzugs med pa dag tu skyes pa'i 'phags pa de bde ba'i dbang po dang mi ldan par 'gyur ro // des ni sa 'phos pas bsam gtan gsum pa zag pa dang bcas pa btang la /
translated: If that were not so, then it would follow that aryas born in the fourth absorption or the formless realm would not possess the faculty of pleasure.üîΩBecause they would have relinquished the contaminated third absorption through changing level and they would not manifest the uncontaminated faculty of pleasure.

original: des zag pa med pa yang mngon du ma byas bas bde ba'i dbang po zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa gnyi ga dang ldan par 'gyur na /
analyzed: des zag pa med pa yang mngon du ma byas bas bde ba'i dbang po zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa gnyi ga dang ldan par 'gyur na /
translated: They would possess both the contaminated and uncontaminated faculty of pleasure.

original: 'phags pa gong du skyes pa ni gdon mi za bar bde ba'i dbang po dang ldan par gsungs te /
analyzed: 'phags pa gong du skyes pa ni gdon mi za bar bde ba'i dbang po dang ldan par gsungs te /
translated: But it is said that aryas born in higher realms definitely possess the faculty of pleasure.

original: bde ba'i dbang po dang ni bsam gtan bzhi pa dang / gzugs med par skyes pa'i so so'i skye bo mi ldan gyi 'phags pa ni ldan no zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bde ba'i dbang po dang ni bsam gtan bzhi pa dang / gzugs med par skyes pa'i so so'i skye bo mi ldan gyi 'phags pa ni ldan no zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Those who are ordinary beings and who are born in the fourth absorption or the formless realm do not possess the faculty of pleasure.

original: gzhan dag na re 'di ni rnam par bshad pa'i nang du bris pa yod mod kyi /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re 'di ni rnam par bshad pa'i nang du bris pa yod mod kyi /
translated: Others say: Although this is written in the Abhidharma,

original: de ni gzhag pa'i phyogs ma yin par mngon te /
analyzed: de ni gzhag pa'i phyogs ma yin par mngon te /
translated: it is not the established position.

original: gzhan dag na re ni zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re ni zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it says ‚Äúothers say,‚Äù

original: 'phags pa bden pa'i dbang po dang ldan no zhes bya ba ni srid pa'i dbang du byas nas bshad par zad do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa bden pa'i dbang po dang ldan no zhes bya ba ni srid pa'i dbang du byas nas bshad par zad do zhes zer ro //
translated: and because it is said that ƒÅryas possess the faculty of true pleasure.üîΩThus, in this way, the presentation of persons who are free from attachment to most or all objects of desire is explained.

original: de ltar re zhig phal cher las dang 'dod pa las 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams kyis zhes bya ba la phal cher las 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams dang 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams kyi nges pa la 'jug pa'i gang zag rnam par gzhag pa niüîΩbshad zin to //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig phal cher las dang 'dod pa las 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams kyis zhes bya ba la phal cher las 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams dang 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams kyi nges pa la 'jug pa'i gang zag rnam par gzhag pa niüîΩbshad zin to //

analyzed: 'di ni re zhig phyir mi 'ong ba rnams kyi dbye ba che long yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: This is the gross classification of non-returners.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: gzugs su nye bar 'gro ba lnga dang gzhan gzugs med par 'gro ba rnam pa bzhi dang / gzhan mthong ba'i chos la mya ngan las 'da' ba zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs su nye bar 'gro ba lnga dang gzhan gzugs med par 'gro ba rnam pa bzhi dang / gzhan mthong ba'i chos la mya ngan las 'da' ba zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'o //
translated: Five who proceed to the form realm, four who proceed to the formless realm, and one who attains nirvana in this life.

original: zhib tu dbye na ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni slob dpon gyis brtsi ba'i thabs rab tu bstan pa'i phyir dang por bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i dbang po dang / sa dang rigs la sogs pa'i khyad par bye brag tu ston par mdzad do //
analyzed: zhib tu dbye na ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni slob dpon gyis brtsi ba'i thabs rab tu bstan pa'i phyir dang por bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i dbang po dang / sa dang rigs la sogs pa'i khyad par bye brag tu ston par mdzad do //
translated: If classified in detail, the master explains the method of calculation in detail, first teaching the distinctions of faculties, levels, lineages, and so on of those who attain nirvana in the intermediate state.

original: dang por bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba bgrang ste /
analyzed: dang por bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba bgrang ste /
translated: First, those who attain nirvana in the intermediate state are counted.

original: de'i bye brag bgrangs na ji ltar bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dbang po la sogs pa'i bre brag gis tha dad par ltar /
analyzed: de'i bye brag bgrangs na ji ltar bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dbang po la sogs pa'i bre brag gis tha dad par ltar /
translated: If you enumerate its specific types, it is like the different types of those who attain nirvana in the intermediate state, who are differentiated by their intellectual faculty and so on.

original: gong du 'pho ba'i bar du yang de dang 'dra ba'i phyir zhes bsgre bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gong du 'pho ba'i bar du yang de dang 'dra ba'i phyir zhes bsgre bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The same applies to those who transfer to a higher level.

original: sa'i bye brag gi gzhi'o zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan bzhi'i bye brag gis te /
analyzed: sa'i bye brag gi gzhi'o zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan bzhi'i bye brag gis te /
translated: The basis of the classification of levels is the four absorptions.

original: bsam gtan dang por bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba nas bsam gtan bzhi bar mya ngan las 'da' ba'i bar ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang por bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba nas bsam gtan bzhi bar mya ngan las 'da' ba'i bar ro //
translated: Those who attain nirvana in the intermediate state in the first absorption and those who attain nirvana in the fourth absorption.

original: rigs kyi bye brag gis drug go zhes bya ba ni yongs su nyams pa'i chos can dang / 'chi bar sems pa'i chos can dang / rjes su bsrungs pa'i chos can dang / gnas pa las mi g-yo ba dang / rtogs pa'i skal ba can dang /üîΩma g-yo ba'i chos can zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rigs kyi bye brag gis drug go zhes bya ba ni yongs su nyams pa'i chos can dang / 'chi bar sems pa'i chos can dang / rjes su bsrungs pa'i chos can dang / gnas pa las mi g-yo ba dang / rtogs pa'i skal ba can dang /üîΩma g-yo ba'i chos can zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The classification of types is six because there are six types: those who fully degenerate, those who die through mental intention, those who guard the path, those who are unshakable, those who are liable to retrogress and those who are immutable.

original: gnas gzhan gyi bye brag gis bcu drug go zhes bya ba ni tshangs ris la sogs pa dag go //
analyzed: gnas gzhan gyi bye brag gis bcu drug go zhes bya ba ni tshangs ris la sogs pa dag go //
translated: The sixteen are the Brahmakayika and so on.

original: sa dang 'dod chags dang bral ba'i bye brag gis sum cu rtsa drug go zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sa dang 'dod chags dang bral ba'i bye brag gis sum cu rtsa drug go zhes bya ba la /
translated: The thirty-six are distinguished by level and freedom from attachment.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is this so?

original: re zhig 'dod pa'i khams las 'dod chags dang bral ba gzugs kyi khams kyi 'ching ba @186a * //üîΩmtha' dag dang ldan pa gcig dang / bsam gtan dang po rnam pa gcig las 'dod chags dang bral ba nas /
analyzed: re zhig 'dod pa'i khams las 'dod chags dang bral ba gzugs kyi khams kyi 'ching ba @186a * // mtha' dag dang ldan pa gcig dang / bsam gtan dang po rnam pa gcig las 'dod chags dang bral ba nas /
translated: First, one who is free from attachment to the desire realm possesses all the bonds of the form realm.

original: rnam pa brgyad las 'dod chags dang bral ba'i bar gzhan brgyad de /üîΩde dag ni sngar gyi 'ching ba mtha' dag dang ldan pa dang bcas te /
analyzed: rnam pa brgyad las 'dod chags dang bral ba'i bar gzhan brgyad de / de dag ni sngar gyi 'ching ba mtha' dag dang ldan pa dang bcas te /
translated: Then, there are eight others who are free from attachment to one stage of the first absorption up to being free from attachment to eight stages.

original: bsam gtan dang po'i dgu yin no //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po'i dgu yin no //
translated: These are the nine stages of the first absorption, including the one who possesses all the bonds mentioned previously.

original: de bzhin du bsam gtan dang po las 'dod chags dang bral ba gnyis pa'i 'ching ba mtha' dag dang ldan pa nas rnam pa brgyad la 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i bar de dag ni gang zag dgu yin no //üîΩde bzhin du bsam gtan gnyis pa'i rnam pa dgu las 'dod chags dang bral ba bsam gtan gsum pa'i 'ching ba mtha' dag dang ldan pa dang / bsam gtan gsum pa'i rnam pa brgyad las 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes bya ba de dag kyang gang zag dgu yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin du bsam gtan dang po las 'dod chags dang bral ba gnyis pa'i 'ching ba mtha' dag dang ldan pa nas rnam pa brgyad la 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i bar de dag ni gang zag dgu yin no // de bzhin du bsam gtan gnyis pa'i rnam pa dgu las 'dod chags dang bral ba bsam gtan gsum pa'i 'ching ba mtha' dag dang ldan pa dang / bsam gtan gsum pa'i rnam pa brgyad las 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes bya ba de dag kyang gang zag dgu yin la /
translated: So too, there are nine types of person from those who are free from attachment to the first absorption and possess all the bonds of the second absorption to those who are free from attachment to the eighth stage of the first absorption.üîΩSo too, there are nine types of person from those who are free from attachment to the nine stages of the second absorption and possess all the bonds of the third absorption to those who are free from attachment to the eighth stage of the third absorption.

original: bsam gtan gsum pa'i rnam pa dgu las 'dod chags dang bral ba bsam gtan bzhi pa'i 'ching ba mtha' dag dang ldan pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi pa'i rnam pa brgyad las 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes bya ba de dag kyang dgu yin te /
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa'i rnam pa dgu las 'dod chags dang bral ba bsam gtan bzhi pa'i 'ching ba mtha' dag dang ldan pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi pa'i rnam pa brgyad las 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes bya ba de dag kyang dgu yin te /
translated: So too, there are nine types of person from those who are free from attachment to the nine stages of the third absorption and possess all the bonds of the fourth absorption to those who are free from attachment to the eighth stage of the fourth absorption.

original: dgu tshan bzhi na sum cu rtsa drug go zhes bya bar grub bo //
analyzed: dgu tshan bzhi na sum cu rtsa drug go zhes bya bar grub bo //
translated: Thus, there are thirty-six types of beings who go to the form realm.

original: bsam gtan bzhi'i dgu pa'i rnam pa las 'dod chags dang bral ba ni ma smos te ;
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi'i dgu pa'i rnam pa las 'dod chags dang bral ba ni ma smos te ;
translated: Those who are free from attachment to the ninth stage of the fourth absorption are not mentioned here because

original: de ni gzugs med pa'i 'ching ba mtha' dag dang ldan pa yin pas gzugs med par nye bar 'gro ba yin na /
analyzed: de ni gzugs med pa'i 'ching ba mtha' dag dang ldan pa yin pas gzugs med par nye bar 'gro ba yin na /
translated: they possess all the bonds of the formless realm and thus go to the formless realm.

original: 'dir ni gzugs su nye bar 'gro ba'i skabs su bab pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dir ni gzugs su nye bar 'gro ba'i skabs su bab pa yin te /
translated: But here the topic is those who go to the form realm.

original: srid pa bar ma dang sbyar ba'i phyir ro //üîΩgnas gcig na rigs drug go zhes bya ba ni tshangs ris kyi gnas na'o ;
analyzed: srid pa bar ma dang sbyar ba'i phyir ro // gnas gcig na rigs drug go zhes bya ba ni tshangs ris kyi gnas na'o ;
translated: This is because it is applied to the intermediate existence.

original: / rigs dang rigs la gang zag dgu dgu'o //
analyzed: / rigs dang rigs la gang zag dgu dgu'o //
translated: Nine types of individuals exist in each of the six types of Brahmakayika gods.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is this so?

original: 'ching ba mtha' dag dang ldan pa nas rang gi bsam gtan gyi rnam pa brgyad las zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: 'ching ba mtha' dag dang ldan pa nas rang gi bsam gtan gyi rnam pa brgyad las zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Those who possess all the bonds up to those who are free from attachment to the eighth stage of their own absorption.

original: rang gi bsam gtan gyi zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan dang po'i'o //
analyzed: rang gi bsam gtan gyi zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan dang po'i'o //
translated: Their own absorption refers to the first absorption.

original: 'di'i rang gi ni bsam gtan dang po tshangs ris so //
analyzed: 'di'i rang gi ni bsam gtan dang po tshangs ris so //
translated: The first absorption is the Brahmakayika gods.

original: dgu tshan drug na zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dgu tshan drug na zhes bya ba la /
translated: Six times nine means

original: rigs drug tshan dgu gzung bas dgu tshan drug ste /
analyzed: rigs drug tshan dgu gzung bas dgu tshan drug ste /
translated: six groups of nine,

original: gcig tu bsdoms na lnga bcu rtsa bzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gcig tu bsdoms na lnga bcu rtsa bzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: which, when added together, make fifty-four.üîΩSixteen times fifty-four means

original: lnga bcu rtsa bzhi phrag bcu drug na zhes bya ba ni gnas gzhan bcu drug bzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lnga bcu rtsa bzhi phrag bcu drug na zhes bya ba ni gnas gzhan bcu drug bzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: sixteen other abodes.

original: tshangs chen ni gnas gzhan ma yin la /
analyzed: tshangs chen ni gnas gzhan ma yin la /
translated: Mahabrahma is not another abode,

original: gnas gzhan yin na @186b yang ;
analyzed: gnas gzhan yin na @186b yang ;
translated: but if it were another abode,

original: der 'phags pa mi skye bas lnga bcu rtsa bzhi phrag bcu drug go //
analyzed: der 'phags pa mi skye bas lnga bcu rtsa bzhi phrag bcu drug go //
translated: then there would be fifty-four abodes, since noble ones are not born there.

original: de dag gcig tu bsdoms na brgyad brgya drug cu rtsa bzhir 'gyur ro //üîΩyang dbang po'i bye brag gis sum 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni brgyad brgya drug cu rtsa bzhi po //
analyzed: de dag gcig tu bsdoms na brgyad brgya drug cu rtsa bzhir 'gyur ro // yang dbang po'i bye brag gis sum 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni brgyad brgya drug cu rtsa bzhi po //
translated: When those are added together, there are eight hundred and sixty-four.üîΩAgain, by the distinction of faculties, it is tripled.

original: dbang po'i bye brag gis sum 'gyur du byas na /
analyzed: dbang po'i bye brag gis sum 'gyur du byas na /
translated: By the distinction of faculties, the eight hundred and sixty-four are tripled.

original: bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba nyis stong lnga brgya dgu bcu rtsa gnyis su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba nyis stong lnga brgya dgu bcu rtsa gnyis su 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who attain nirvana in the intermediate state become two thousand five hundred and ninety-two.

original: bsam gtan 'og ma'i zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: bsam gtan 'og ma'i zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: The term lower meditative stabilization is explained in detail.

original: bsam gtan 'og ma ste dang po nas gsum pa'i bar gyi rnam pa dgu las 'dod chags dang bral ba gang yin pa de ni gong ma ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan 'og ma ste dang po nas gsum pa'i bar gyi rnam pa dgu las 'dod chags dang bral ba gang yin pa de ni gong ma ste /
translated: One who is free from attachment to the nine stages of the first to third absorptions is higher.

original: gnyis pa nas bzhi pa'i bar gyi 'ching ba mtha' dag dang ldan pa yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: gnyis pa nas bzhi pa'i bar gyi 'ching ba mtha' dag dang ldan pa yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: One who possesses all the ties bandhana of the second to fourth absorptions is explained.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mnyam par brtsis pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'byung ste /üîΩci nas kyang bsam gtan bzhi pa na /
analyzed: mnyam par brtsis pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'byung ste / ci nas kyang bsam gtan bzhi pa na /
translated: Because they are counted equally.

original: dgu dgur 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgu dgur 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the fourth absorption is counted as nine stages,

original: de lta ma yin na mi 'dra bar brtsis par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na mi 'dra bar brtsis par 'gyur ro //
translated: otherwise they would be counted as unequal.

original: gal te nyon mongs pa rnam pa dgu spangs pa'i bye brag gis dgur brtsis na ni /
analyzed: gal te nyon mongs pa rnam pa dgu spangs pa'i bye brag gis dgur brtsis na ni /
translated: If they are counted as nine due to the specific abandonment of the nine types of affliction,

original: da lta na mi 'dra bar brtsis par 'gyur te /
analyzed: da lta na mi 'dra bar brtsis par 'gyur te /
translated: they would be counted as unequal now,

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa na rnam pa dgu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa na rnam pa dgu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the fourth absorption does not have nine stages.

original: de'i rnam pa dgu las 'dod chags dang bral ba de ni gzugs med par nye bar 'gro ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i rnam pa dgu las 'dod chags dang bral ba de ni gzugs med par nye bar 'gro ba yin no //
translated: Those who are detached from nine stages of the form realm go to the formless realm.

original: gong du 'pho ba'i bar du yang de dang 'dra bas zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gong du 'pho ba'i bar du yang de dang 'dra bas zhes bya ba la /
translated: Those who go to the formless realm should be applied in the same way as those who go to the form realm, but they are not mentioned because they are easy to understand.üîΩThose who relocate to higher levels, those who are detached from attachment to lower levels, and those who are detached from nine stages of the form realm go to the formless realm.

original: skyes nas dang mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pa dang / mngon par 'du byed pa med pa dang / gong du 'pho ba rnams la yang gnas gzhan dang / rigs dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / dbang po'i bye brag gis snga ma bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: skyes nas dang mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pa dang / mngon par 'du byed pa med pa dang / gong du 'pho ba rnams la yang gnas gzhan dang / rigs dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / dbang po'i bye brag gis snga ma bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Those who relocate to higher levels should be applied in the same way as those who go to the form realm, but they are not mentioned because they are easy to understand.

original: 'dir gong du 'pho ba gzugs su nye bar 'gro ba gzung gi / gzugs med pa nye bar 'gro ba ni ma yin no //üîΩde nyid kyi phyir 'dir bsam gtan bzhi pa na /
analyzed: 'dir gong du 'pho ba gzugs su nye bar 'gro ba gzung gi / gzugs med pa nye bar 'gro ba ni ma yin no // de nyid kyi phyir 'dir bsam gtan bzhi pa na /
translated: Those who relocate to higher levels are not mentioned here because they go to the form realm, but not to the formless realm.

original: rnam pa dgu pa las 'dod chags dang bral ba ma bgrangs te /
analyzed: rnam pa dgu pa las 'dod chags dang bral ba ma bgrangs te /
translated: Therefore, those detached from the ninth stage of the fourth absorption are not counted here.

original: de ni gzugs med par nye bar 'gro ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni gzugs med par nye bar 'gro ba yin no //
translated: They go to the formless realm.

original: de'i phyir de ltar na phyir mi 'ong ba gzugs su nye bar 'gro ba lnga'i dbye ba byas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar na phyir mi 'ong ba gzugs su nye bar 'gro ba lnga'i dbye ba byas par 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, nonreturners who proceed to the form realm are classified as five.

original: 'di lta ste /üîΩbar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / mngon par 'du byed pa med par yongs su mya ngan las @187a * //
analyzed: 'di lta ste / bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / mngon par 'du byed pa med par yongs su mya ngan las @187a * //
translated: They are:

original: 'da' ba dang / gong du 'pho ba'o //
analyzed: 'da' ba dang / gong du 'pho ba'o //
translated: nonreturners who attain nirvana in the intermediate state, nonreturners who attain nirvana after taking birth, nonreturners who attain nirvana through application, nonreturners who attain nirvana without application and nonreturners who relocate to higher levels.

original: thams cad bsdus na phyir mi 'ong ba khri nyis stong dgu brgya rtsa drug cu yin te /
analyzed: thams cad bsdus na phyir mi 'ong ba khri nyis stong dgu brgya rtsa drug cu yin te /
translated: If all are combined, there are 12,960 nonreturners.

original: bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba nyis stong lnga brgya dgu bcu rtsa gnyis lnga 'gyur du byas nas zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba nyis stong lnga brgya dgu bcu rtsa gnyis lnga 'gyur du byas nas zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: It is thought that nonreturners who attain nirvana in the intermediate state are 2,592 multiplied by five.

original: ji skad bshad pa'i tshul 'dis phyir mi 'ong ba gzugs med par nye bar 'gro ba bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ma gtogs pa rnams kyi dbye ba khong du chud par bya ste /
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i tshul 'dis phyir mi 'ong ba gzugs med par nye bar 'gro ba bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ma gtogs pa rnams kyi dbye ba khong du chud par bya ste /
translated: One should understand the classification of nonreturners who proceed to the formless realm, except for those who attain nirvana in the intermediate state, in accordance with the method just explained.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams ni skye ba las rnam pa bzhi zhig tu zad do //üîΩsrid rtse'i bar cha brgyad zad pa dgra bcom pa nyid la zhugs pa yin zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams ni skye ba las rnam pa bzhi zhig tu zad do // srid rtse'i bar cha brgyad zad pa dgra bcom pa nyid la zhugs pa yin zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The formless realm is exhausted in four types of birth.üîΩOne who has destroyed up to the eighth stage of the summit of existence is a candidate for the state of an arhat.

original: srid pa'i rtse mo'i rnam pa brgyad zad par byed pa ni zhes bya ba'i don yin te /
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo'i rnam pa brgyad zad par byed pa ni zhes bya ba'i don yin te /
translated: The meaning is that one who has destroyed up to the eighth stage of the summit of existence.

original: dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu ni de'i mjug thogs su yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu ni de'i mjug thogs su yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the result of an arhat is immediately subsequent to that.

original: dgu pa'i bar chad med lam yang //
analyzed: dgu pa'i bar chad med lam yang //
translated: The uninterrupted path of the ninth stageüîΩis also a candidate for the state of an arhat.

original: zhes bya ba ci zhe na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ci zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning?

original: dgra bcom nyid la zhugs pa yin //üîΩzhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar te /
analyzed: dgra bcom nyid la zhugs pa yin // zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar te /
translated: One who has destroyed up to the eighth stage of the summit of existence is a candidate for the state of an arhat.

original: rnam par grol ba'i lam la dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i lam la dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one obtains the result of an arhat on the path of liberation.

original: de ni rdo rje lta bu yin //
analyzed: de ni rdo rje lta bu yin //
translated: That is the vajra like concentration.

original: zhes bya ba ni srid pa'i rtse mo'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa dgu pa spong bar byed pa'i bar chad med pa'i lam de ni snyam du dgongs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni srid pa'i rtse mo'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa dgu pa spong bar byed pa'i bar chad med pa'i lam de ni snyam du dgongs so //
translated: This is the uninterrupted path that abandons the ninth affliction of the summit of existence.

original: 'di rdo rje dang 'dra bas na rdo rje lta bu ste /
analyzed: 'di rdo rje dang 'dra bas na rdo rje lta bu ste /
translated: It is called vajra-like because it is like a vajra.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For that very reason,

original: phra rgyas thams cad 'joms pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: phra rgyas thams cad 'joms pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: it is said that it destroys all negative tendencies.

original: ji ltar rdo rjes thams cad 'joms pa de bzhin du ting nge 'dzin 'dis kyang phra rgyas thams cad 'joms te /
analyzed: ji ltar rdo rjes thams cad 'joms pa de bzhin du ting nge 'dzin 'dis kyang phra rgyas thams cad 'joms te /
translated: Just as a vajra destroys everything, so too this concentration destroys all negative tendencies.

original: 'di'i rdo rje dang chos mthun pa ni 'di yin no zhes bstan to //
